title: Bug fix issue #1839, changes
body:
* Extracted out PageTitle object's member varaible, displayText in a variable in findTemplate() in MediaDataExtractor
* added null checks for the same varaible [Lets be safe side]
* replaced equals with contains, ie. displayText.contains(title), so that uploads from multiple sources which have different formats still show up coordinates which was not being shown earlier

## Coordinates not showing up in "My Recent Uploads" picture

Fixes #{GitHub issue number #1839 and title Coordinates not showing up in "My Recent Uploads" picture } 

## Description
Fixes #{#1839}

The getTemplate() function in MediaDataExtractor used to extract data by searching for the elements to be shown in the ui. One of which is location. Now location for images uploaded from web and mobile had different formats for an example see 
One uploaded from the app:
    {{Location|12.958117388888889|77.6440805}}
One uploaded from elsewhere:
{{Location dec|47.99081|7.845416|heading:255.9}}

Clearly an exact string match for string Location would show null results for the later. So added contains instead of equals to solve the same. 
## Tests performed (required)

Tested on {27 & Samsung s7}, with {ProdDebug}.

## Screenshots showing what changed (optional)
 
![device-2018-08-21-232201](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17375274/44419572-37d3b200-a599-11e8-839b-e7a7ff4fa02b.png)

{Only for user interface changes, otherwise remove this section. See [how to take a screenshot](https://android.stackexchange.com/questions/1759/how-to-take-a-screenshot-with-an-android-device)}

_Note: Please ensure that you have read CONTRIBUTING.md if this is your first pull request._

title: Add button "use app" to Commons:Upload and/or main page
label: [Label(name="publicity")]
body:
I think it's time to add link to our app to [Wikimedia Commons main page](https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/Main_Page) and/or to the [default Upload Wizard](https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/Special:UploadWizard). 

What do you think? Ideas on how to make this happen?

An even more radical solution would be to detect visitors coming to Wikimedia Commons page from a mobile device and suggesting them to download the app. But that is maybe still premature.

title: Add text field to media details view for users to copy image template into Wikipedia
label: [Label(name="assigned"), Label(name="beginner friendly"), Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
As posted on FB, 

> it occurred me to directly try to use an uploaded image to an article in wp
> And when I tailored on the image I saw all the details... Plus a "nominate for deletion" option, but no "use this file"
> Wouldn't it be a good idea to have an automatically generated string [[file:... |right|thumb|description]] that will make the use of uploaded images through the app easier?
> Maybe even two more fields for project (like "bg.wp" for Bulgarian Wikipedia (search suggest?) and another field for the article name.
> In this way with the wiki code the user will be able to have the desired article opened in edit mode and just locate the place where to add the image uploaded through the app

We can just add this as one of the items in media details view I guess, along with categories, desc, etc. Could have a button at the side of the field where, when tapped, will copy the wikicode to clipboard along with a toast. Should be fairly straightforward to implement.

title: Unable to install beta and prod variants simultaneously
body:
**Summary:** 

After #1725 got fixed in #1726, beta and prod variants should coexist on the same device. Recent changes have again started build failures when trying to install beta over prod. 

**Steps to reproduce:**

title: Hotfix for overwrite issue in 2.8.0
body:
## Title (required)

Fixes #228 Override happens

## Description (required)

Fixes #228  What I did is checking the extension, and if it is null, adding .jpg suffix. Because commons files always have suffixes, and we should compare file names after adding suffixes. Otherwise overrides are possible.


## Tests performed (required)

BetaDebug, API level 19 (this was the only emulator that I could reproduce the issue)

Fixedthe problem for me.

title: Using the same filename in v2.8 overwrites the existing file
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="high priority")]
body:
**Summary:** 

I received a report from a user that creating a second file with the same filename as the first, overwrites the first file - https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Venner%C3%B8d_skole.jpeg

This should not happen. While we have had a few overwrite issues (see #703 ), they are not usually as straightforward as this one. The app should be adding a numbered suffix if the filename exists, and it seems that has changed recently. I wonder if some of the changes made recently to the upload process would have caused this?

@neslihanturan could you check if the upload workflow change affected this? Thanks.

**Steps to reproduce:** 

Upload a file, then upload another one with the same filename. 

**Device and Android version:** 

@PeterFisk could you please fill this in?
 
 **Commons app version:** 

2.8.1

**Would you like to work on the issue?**

Pref not

title: Added CDATA tag
body:
## Description (required)

Fixes #1772 No source text for Commons-android-strings-welcome_help_button_text (commons-android-strings)

Added the CDATA tag to the strings which had the `<u>` tag. Set the text of the corresponding textviews using the Html.fromHtml() function in the corresponding Java files.

## Tests performed (required)

Tested on device Motorola Moto G(5) (Android 7.0, API 24), with build variant betaDebug.

title: Use NotificationChannel and prevent crash in API 26
body:
## Title (required)

Fixes #1834 "Notification-related crashes on Android 8.1 (API 27)".

## Description (required)

Fixes #1834 "Notification-related crashes on Android 8.1 (API 27)".

Apparently Android 8.1 requires a notification category to be set for each notification: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/47531742/startforeground-fail-after-upgrade-to-android-8-1 and I introduced a catch-all category for this app.

## Tests performed (required)

Tested on Android 8.1 device. [Passed Travis tests.](https://travis-ci.org/whym/apps-android-commons/builds/417545112?utm_source=github_status&utm_medium=notification)

title: Get ACRA crash reporting system working again
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
**Summary:** 

We used to have ACRA crash reports. Then we didn't. Then we fixed that. But now we don't have them again. These reports are very useful because they allow users to add comments to tell us what they were doing at the time of the crash

**Steps to reproduce:** 

Generate a crash. If ACRA reports were working, there would be an option to report the crash (not just close or reopen app).

**Device and Android version:** 

Several different ones, including API 21 and API 24
 
 **Commons app version:** 

Current master

**Would you like to work on the issue?**

Preferably not

title: Versioning and changelog for v2.8.1
Categories with pipe suffix
label: [Label(name="assigned"), Label(name="bug"), Label(name="media details")]
body:
**Steps to reproduce:** 

1. With the app, find this picture of an interesting mushroom: https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Cortinarius_vanduzerensis_134617.jpg
2. Notice how its categories are ended with `|・` or `|Mushroom`
3. Press the category. The app opens the category view activity, and shows zero media, evn though there should be at least that image present.

![screenshot_20180811-190736](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/99590/44076143-167b1e8c-9fda-11e8-8050-e2cd94dba80d.png)

Source of the file:
```
{{Assessments|enwiki=1|enwiki-nom=Cortinarius vanduzerensis|featured=1}}
== {{int:filedesc}} ==
{{Information
|Description    ={{en|1=A fruit body of the North American mushroom '''''{{C|Cortinarius vanduzerensis}}''''' − A.H. Sm. & Trappe. 
*Specimen photographed in {{C|Salt Point State Park}}, Sonoma County, northern California, U.S.}}
|Source         ={{MushroomObserver|134617}}
|Author         =[http://mushroomobserver.org/observer/show_user/10 John Kirkpatrick (natashadak)]
|Date           =2011-02-15
|Permission     =
|other_versions =
}}

== {{int:license-header}} ==
{{cc-by-sa-3.0}}

[[Category:Cortinarius vanduzerensis]]
[[Category:Salt Point State Park|•]]
[[Category:Fungi of Sonoma County, California|Mushroom]]
{{LicenseReview|site=http://mushroomobserver.org/image/show_image/134617|user=Leoboudv|date=2017-12-22}}
```

I guess it is some sort of Commons convention? If anyone is familiar with such syntax please explain to us what it is, thanks!

I suppose we can safely remove the pipe and everything after it.

 **Commons app version:** 

Latest master

title: Fixes #1801  (Media details view for Browse is lacking author field)
body:
## Fixes
- Fixes #1805 (Expected adapter item count: 20, found: 30)
- Fixes #1801  (Media details view for Browse is lacking author field)
- Fixes #1519  (Swiping featured images limited to 10 images) 


## Description (required)

- Changed parameters in API to receive image info too
- Changed visibility Conditions in render to show author name too
- notifiedViewPager onSuccess of each API response
- added listener to ViewPager to detect last page and calling API for more responses then.

Link to documentation: https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/api.php?action=help&modules=query%2Bsearch

API used: https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/api.php?action=query&generator=search&gsrsearch=iit%20ism%20dhanbad&gsrnamespace=6&gsrwhat=text&prop=imageinfo&format=xml

## Tests performed (required)

Manually Tested on API 25, with ProdDebug variant

## Screenshots showing what changed (optional)

title: Fixes#1803 Changed default value of skip login to false
body:
## Description (required)

Fixes #1803 (Prompted to log in even though I am already logged in)
- Changed default value of skip login to false

## Tests performed (required)
Manually Tested on API 25, with ProdDebug variant.

title: Username in nav drawer should be centered
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="gsoc 2018")]
body:
**Summary:** 

My username in the nav drawer is left-aligned. It should be centered under the Commons logo, IMO. @tanvidadu was there a reason for changing the alignment? I recall it used to be centered?

**Device and Android version:** 

Android 8.0.0 Samsung Galaxy s7
 
 **Commons app version:** 

2.8-release

**Screen-shots:** 

![screenshot_20180808-010018_commons](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3611199/43784727-17d949e8-9aa8-11e8-9236-b78faf6f252b.jpg)

**Would you like to work on the issue?**

Pref not

title: Nearby uploads occasionally fail
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="nearby")]
body:
**Summary:** 

As mentioned at #1749 , occasionally uploads via Nearby fail. This happened once to me while testing #1749 and another time while testing #1800 . It does not happen for uploads via ContributionsActivity.

**Steps to reproduce:** 

Upload via Nearby map or list, several times.

**Add System logs:**

Unfortunately I did not manage to get logs for this. But it might be reproducible by others, as it appears to be random

**Device and Android version:** 

Android 8.0.0 Samsung Galaxy s7
 
 **Commons app version:** 

Current 2.8-release

**Would you like to work on the issue?**

title: Improve the algorithm for detecting unwanted images.
body:
## Modified ImageUtils.java

Fixes #1767 "Too dark" for picture with black background 

## Description (required)

Fixes #1767 "Too dark" for picture with black background
ImageUtils.java: algorithm used previously gave the 'TOO DARK' message even for the images that were perfectly valid.

The modified algorithm solves this problem. It is as follows:

- Count the number of pixels with high brightness

- Count the number of pixels with medium brightness

- If numberOfBrightPixels is below 2.5% AND numberOfMediumBrightnessPixels is below 30%, then the picture is too dark.

## Tests performed (required)
Tested on device Motorola Moto G(5) (Android 7.0, API 24), with build variant betaDebug.

title: Only do http logging if a debug build is run
body:
We should not log cookie headers without informing users, due to privacy concerns. For the time being, http header logging should be restricted to debug builds (which will never be released, but can only be built manually via our repo). See https://github.com/commons-app/apps-android-commons/pull/1751/files#r205656568

Tested on Nexus One emulator on API 24, it displays http headers on debug and not on release.

title: added null check before initialising LatLng after receiving location …
body:
…permission

## Nearby crash fix

Fixes #1735 [Nearby crash when LatLng is null] 

## Description (required)
After receiving location permission from user, while fetching last known location, we used to initialise LatLng from last known location which could be fetched from either GPS_PROVIDER or NETWORK_PROVIDER. There was a null check on the one fetched from GPS_PROVIDER but not on the one fetched from NETWORK_PROVIDER.

Fixes #1735 [Nearby crash when LatLng is null] 
Added a null check on the last known location fetched from NETWORK_PROVIDER

Tested on {27  & emulator google pixel}, with {build variant, betaDebug}.

title: Looking for a part-time Android dev to join our team
label: [Label(name="IEG")]
body:
As mentioned at #1683, we intend to apply for a WMF-funded [Project Grant](https://meta.wikimedia.org/wiki/Grants:Project) to continue our work on the app, after successfully completing our current IEG grant renewal. In the new grant application, we'd like to expand our grantee team (currently consisting of myself, @maskaravivek and @neslihanturan) by one person.

### Role
- Development of our Android app, primarily fixing bugs and crashes. Currently, we are stuck in a cycle of needing to put new feature releases on hold every now and then to fix the inevitable bugs/crashes. We are hoping that with an additional team member focusing on bugfixes, we will be able to complete our next grant in a more timely manner and release new features regularly, while keeping the app bug-free and polished. We also have a backlog of existing bugs/crashes that need to be looked into.
- Additionally, you may need to test/debug implementations, and communicate with users who report problems on our google groups forum or GitHub to get more details about the issues they are facing.

### Details
- This will be a 10 hr/week role starting March 2019 (if our grant application is approved) and most likely lasting for 9 months, with potential for renewal. 
- Our grant application is due Nov 2018, and I usually prefer to complete the proposal and start requesting community feedback at least a month beforehand, so we would need to make our decisions on the new team member by Sep/Oct 2018 at the latest. Due to this, the deadline for your application is **25 Aug 2018**.
- You can work from home and on a schedule of your own choosing. We do not require fixed work hours, but we do expect to see work completed in a timely and quality manner.

### Criteria
- Proficiency in Android app development and open-source collaborative development
- Preference will be given to applicants who have made extensive, high-quality contributions to our repo
- Ability to manage your own time and work with a geographically-distributed team

### Remuneration
- This is definitely a paid role, however I will honestly state that we are limited in what we can offer. From my experience, the grants committee judges proposals rather strictly based on how much funding they are asking for, and whether or not they believe the amount is justified. We always do our best to pay everyone fairly, but you can get an idea of upper limits of pay based on our [current grant](https://meta.wikimedia.org/wiki/Grants:IEG/Improve_%27Upload_to_Commons%27_Android_App/Renewal#Budget_breakdown) . 
- Please also note that this is not a guaranteed job offer - we will include the successful applicant as a member of our team in our grant proposal, but the final decision of whether to approve or decline the proposal lies with WMF. That being said, 2/2 of our previous proposals have been approved, so we are hopeful.

### Benefits
It's not all doom and gloom. All of your work will be open source, and we are happy to provide any references needed. We are part of the Wikimedia ecosystem and are often offered scholarships to attend Wikimedia events. The improvements you make to our app will benefit 3000+ users who uploaded 12000+ images to Wikimedia Commons in the last quarter. I'd also like to think that we are fairly easygoing people who are fun to work with. 😉

This role would be well-suited to a final-year student or someone who is just starting out in their career and is looking for open-source work experience to add to their resume.

### If you are interested
Please apply [here](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/19FxiJlMUNFAKLyEAcDCTlSoqoQox-TFOmdF5nZbRgK4/) .

title: Use a library for checking various permissions
label: [Label(name="assigned"), Label(name="code-quality"), Label(name="debated"), Label(name="discussion")]
body:
**Summary:** 

Our app asks for runtime permissions in various places and in the past we have run into several issues/crashes because of missing permissions checks. The process of ensuring that permission is granted is cumbersome:
- check for permission
- request permission if not granted
- check if the user granted permission
- execute method or else handle failure

Making sure that all these steps are followed correctly is a tedious task. It might be fruitful if we start using a 3rd party library for checking and handling permissions. I have tried out these two libraries in the past and found both of them to be quite useful. 

-  https://github.com/permissions-dispatcher/PermissionsDispatcher
- https://github.com/Karumi/Dexter


The first library uses simple annotations and the second library provides callback. All the hassle of checking and requesting permissions is taken care by the library itself.

title: Provide a selectable list of reasons when requesting deletion of a file
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
**Summary:** 

The app allows the user to request the deletion of a file they uploaded from the Media details screen. The user has to provide a reason for deletion in free form text there. I suggest providing a selectable list of typical reasons to ease input and help other users to understand.

The most typical reason would probably be "_new, unused, upload by myself_" if the file has been uploaded recently enough. (generally, within 7 days since upload, the reason would be accepted by Commons administrators by default) For older photos, something along the lines of "_unused and personal photo, out of scope_" might be a good alternative.

I quickly checked https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/Special:NewPages?namespace=4&tagfilter=mobile+app+edit&username=&size-mode=min&size= which shows a list of deletion requests created using the app. The results of the requests can be classified as below:

* deleted (request accepted) - 23
* kept (request rejected) - 8
* undecided - 18

So at least a majority of them are accepted, which is good, but I believe we want to have less rejected cases.

The option of free text input should still be available, and ideally the selected reason should be editable.

 **Commons app version:** 

master version.

![_at_ _](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/99590/43393370-c6806e40-9431-11e8-9950-05cf9f18694c.jpg)

label: [Label(name="beta"), Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="gsoc 2018")]
body:
I think that a space is needed here.

![screenshot from 2018-07-29 11-01-44](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/99590/43362193-d673194c-931e-11e8-9961-ec05d8a6794a.png)

title: Quiz electric bus question: Change the wording a bit
label: [Label(name="beta"), Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="gsoc 2018")]
body:
![screenshot from 2018-07-29 10-55-19](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/99590/43362167-fc7bdc74-931d-11e8-933c-95ad8daacc42.png)

I fear that many people will focus on the electric bus with realizing that the point of the question is about it being a screenshot.
People may think "Is a picture of an electric bus OK to upload? Sure it is!"

Solution: How about changing the wording to "Is this screenshot OK to upload?"

I guess this is not trivial, as it makes this slide a special case in the code, but it would certainly avoid misunderstanding and frustration for many users :-)

title: Switch achievements button from "person" icon to trophy icon?
label: [Label(name="gsoc 2018"), Label(name="question")]
body: Minor issue - IMO the "person" icon next to the username on the nav bar looks like it would lead to a user profile, not an Achievements screen. To make it more explicit to users, how about a trophy icon? What do you guys think, anyone have any other suggestions? @nicolas-raoul @neslihanturan @tanvidadu @maskaravivek

title: Add a bookmark option in media Details
label: [Label(name="assigned"), Label(name="browsing")]
body:
**Summary:** 
When exploring feature will be available to everyone. A lot of people will download images uploaded by others. But they users will not get the same in an Organised manner. It would be nice if we can have a bookmark option in media details menu and store the bookmarked filenames in the local history and show a list of bookmarked images later may be in the drawer of somewhere.

title: Calculate how many users decided to create an account (after "skip login" is implemented)
body:
**Summary:** 

As you know, we are about to implement skip login feature #1238 as discussed here, thanks to @ujjwalagrawal17 . After this implementation is done, maybe we can count how many user browsed logged out, then decided to create a new account. It would be nice to know our contribution to number of commons users.

We need to be careful to prevent privacy violation.

title: Bug in skip login option
body:
**Summary:** 

1- Open app without logged in
2- Click on login from navbar
3- Click back button in login activity
4- You will see nav bar as in you are logged in, while you are not.

title: Fix urgent crashes   A and E
body:
## Description

Fixes A and E from #1545 (I hope). It saves file which is being uploaded to a temp location, and uses Uri of that file as reference during upload process, instead of using Uri that content provider supported.

## Tests performed (required)

Tested on API 23, beta debug. Tested actions: share photo from another application, share multiple photos from another application and contributing via contributions list. 

Not: Finally a beautiful commit history!

title: Fixes #1545 Top crashes on Play Store for v2.7.1 [A and E]
body:
## Description

Fixes A and E from #1545 (I hope). It saves file which is being uploaded to a temp location, and uses Uri of that file as reference during upload process, instead of using Uri that content provider supported.

## Tests performed (required)

Tested on API 23, beta debug. Tested actions: share photo from another application, share multiple 
photos from another application and contributing via contributions list. 

I closed previous PR for same reason, working on master... Then I created a new branch and cherry picked my changes on top of it. Finally fixed history.

title: Strange animation when viewing any image
label: [Label(name="UX - user experience"), Label(name="bug"), Label(name="gsoc 2018 browse important")]
body:
**Steps to reproduce:** 

1. Go to "My uploads" or "Explore" or browse a category
2. Press an image

Expected: The image just shows up
Actually: The previous image is briefly shown, and then a sliding happens before the image is shown

 **Commons app version:** 

Current master.
I just noticed that today, I don't think it happened with two days ago's master

title: Make achievements more prominent?
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="gamification")]
body:
If I understand correctly, the only way to reach achievements is to click the small "user" icon at the right of the user name?
I believe most people may not find it. How about showing the level of the person instead of that icon?
For instance (with "level 5" being underlined to show it is clickable):
```
JoeFromHCMC - level 5
```
or maybe:
```
JoeFromHCMC
level 5
```

title: More levels?
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="gamification")]

title: Fix explore crash
body:
## Title (required)
Fixes #1741 (Attempt to invoke virtual method 'void android.support.v4.view.ViewPager.setCurrentItem(int)' on a null object reference)

## Description (required)
- Handler for 0.01 sec added because viewpager was null immidiiately after oncreate. (I couldn't find any other solution till now)

## Tests performed (required)

**Summary:**

**Steps to reproduce:**

I tried resetting the device, and loging out and in again, with no luck.

title: Prevent uploading media that already exists on Commons
label: [Label(name="beginner friendly"), Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
The app currently allows to upload a picture twice. Actually, I have uploaded some pictures 3 times because I could not remember whether I had uploaded yet or not.

Before starting the upload (possibly when entering the title/description), the app should check whether the picture has been already uploaded or not, using [this](https://opendata.stackexchange.com/questions/5279/live-database-of-checksums-of-all-files-on-wikimedia-commons/7314#7314).

If the picture exists already on Commons, the app should tell the user and go back to the previous activity.

title: New Wikidata item based on this picture
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
WikiShootMe has this feature:
![screenshot_20180623-122754](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/99590/43000423-4ddc5332-8c5c-11e8-819a-7507f045515e.png)
It can be useful to add a bridge or a destroyer that does not exist in Wikidata yet.

- We must ask for a label and description, we could pre-fill them with the picture's title and description
- We must ask what class the item is an instance of.
- We must ask for the exact location, which is probably slightly different from the picture's location

This feature should be limited to expert users, as we don't want people to create duplicate (ex:new item for Italy) or useless (ex: new item for their cat). Maybe we can limit to physical locations and force the user to review nearby items (both those with and without an image, of course).

title: Fix conflict between different product flavors
body:
Fix conflict between different product flavors so that beta and prod apps could coexist

## Title (required)

Fixes #1725

## Tests performed (required)

Able to install and log in to both beta and prod flavors of the app simultaneously. 

## Screenshots showing what changed (optional)
 
![device-2018-07-18-183232](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3069373/42883352-08836ee6-8ab9-11e8-9b91-13074f1cd0cd.png)

title: Beta and prod flavor of the app should coexist
body:
**Summary:** 

Right now, if the prod flavor of the app is installed then the beta installation gets overridden. This happens because of the following issues:

- beta and prod app use the same application ID
- account type is same for both flavors
- content providers are the same for both flavors. 

These things need to be fixed so that both the app can coexist. 

This could be a potential issue(not sure if its the only issue) for uploads being failing (#1485). The reasoning behind it is: 

- if the same `ACCOUNT_TYPE` is used for both beta and prod accounts then the auth-token would be incorrect

**Steps to reproduce:** 
Install prod variant over the beta one. Upload fails. 


**Would you like to work on the issue?**

Yes.

title: Parent categories loading icon keeps spinning forever, even after coming back to stable network
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="gsoc 2018 browse")]
body:
I kept pressing random subcategories and random parent categories on my way from outside.
When the phone connected to my home WiFi (I guess but maybe it is irrelevant), the tab I was on did not leave the state where the waiting icon spins. It has been spinning for 10 minutes now. Below is a part of the logcat that seems to match that timing. Note the CalledFromWrongThreadException at the end.

title: Implements of in-app EXIF and location anonymization
body:
## Title (required)

Fixes #1686 Implementation of in-app EXIF modification
Fixes #212 Remove from EXIF: copyright field (name)
Fixes #181 Remove from EXIF: geo info if too close to home
Fixes #70 Option to "anonymize" pictures 

## Description (required)

There are multiple issues about privacy concerns location and EXIF-related privacy concerns. These commits implement two different settings for removing certain EXIF rags from the picture and for reducing the accuracy or completely eliminating geolocation data from the picture.

The bulk of the anonymization logic is implemented in FileProcessor to prevent code reuse. The existing coordinate extraction logic in MultipleShareActivity is also replaced by a FileProcessor to further reduce code reuse.

Add method anonymizeCoord() that reduces the resolution of GPS coordinates. Think of each coordinate as a pixel. This function reduces the resolution of "the world" to one coordinate(pixel) for every x kilometres (x is the variable prefLocationAccuracy). This approach was chosen over changing the coordinates by a random amount because with that approach; if a user uploads sufficiently many pictures from the same location, statistical analysis can reveal the real location of the user. 

The Android support library com.android.support:exifinterface was added as some required features are lacking from earlier Android versions.

As a minor detail, strings.xml was standardized to 4 spaces per tab. That's why there are so many removed lines.

## Tests performed (required)

Tested on API 22 Genymotion Google Nexus 5 emulator, with build variant, BetaDebug and ProdDebug.

## Screenshots showing what changed (optional)

title: Enhancing stacktraces from RxJava
label: [Label(name="code-quality"), Label(name="question")]
body:
Stacktraces from RxJava callables are often not very helpful. They contain no trace of which line in our codebase caused the issue. For eg recently we were trying to figure out a play store crash #1545(C). The below stacktrace doesn't tell which part of the code led to NPE. 

```
java.lang.NullPointerException: 
  at io.reactivex.internal.functions.ObjectHelper.requireNonNull (ObjectHelper.java:39)
  at io.reactivex.internal.operators.observable.ObservableFromCallable.subscribeActual (ObservableFromCallable.java:42)
  at io.reactivex.Observable.subscribe (Observable.java:10901)
  at io.reactivex.internal.operators.observable.ObservableSubscribeOn$SubscribeTask.run (ObservableSubscribeOn.java:96)
  at io.reactivex.Scheduler$DisposeTask.run (Scheduler.java:452)
  at io.reactivex.internal.schedulers.ScheduledRunnable.run (ScheduledRunnable.java:61)
  at io.reactivex.internal.schedulers.ScheduledRunnable.call (ScheduledRunnable.java:52)
  at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run (FutureTask.java:237)
  at java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$ScheduledFutureTask.access$201 (ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:152)
  at java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$ScheduledFutureTask.run (ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:265)
  at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker (ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1112)
  at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run (ThreadPoolExecutor.java:587)
  at java.lang.Thread.run (Thread.java:818)
```

Is there a way to enhance these logs. I found a few libraries for the same:

- https://github.com/T-Spoon/Traceur
- https://github.com/akaita/RxJava2Debug

It would be great if someone who has experience with reactive programming could pitch in with suggestions?

@psh @whym

title: Enhancement requests: Add images in the user gallery, EXIF date taken
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Hi, I would like to suggest making two enhancements of the Commons app:

1. It would be nice if the app could add the uploaded images in the user gallery, as VicuňaUploader can, letting the user choose the size of the image, name of the part of the gallery, and whether the new bit should go to the top or bottom of the page.

2. I have noticed that the date uploaded to Commons probably takes the date of the upload, not the image date taken. Similarly to how VicuňaUploader does it, it is the date taken that should be uploaded, IMHO, not the current date, unless the user wants it to be different. What happened today is that the date uploaded was today's one (upload date), not the one of digitalizing the image, i.e. taking the photo, which was 2 days ago. Example: https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Vy%C5%A1n%C3%BD_(%C4%8Cesk%C3%BD_Krumlov),_U_Kas%C3%A1ren_(01).jpg - had to change the date to the correct one, apart from having to add categories which failed to upload (it is dealt with in [another thread](https://github.com/commons-app/apps-android-commons/issues/310)).

I am not able to help solving the issue but will gladly participate in testing any changes.

Thanks for considering the suggestions,
Czeva

title: App doesnot ask for permission when multiple pics are shared
label: [Label(name="assigned"), Label(name="bug")]
body:
**Summary:** 

App doesnot ask for storage permission when multiple pics are shared through gallery.


**Steps to reproduce:** 
1.Select pics you want to share through any gallery.
2.Click on the share button.
3.Select the commons app from the recommended app list.
4.The dialogue box which should appear asking for storage permission doesnot appear.



**Device and Android version:** 
Motorola G(4) (android 7.0,API 24).

 **Commons app version:** 
2.7.2-debug-master~d7b956e5

**Screen-shots:** 
![screenshot_20180709-005352](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26187363/42423189-007dcd1a-8314-11e8-9cec-461326a71aba.png)
![screenshot_20180709-005413](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26187363/42423190-02782462-8314-11e8-8eb4-9a91cfe56164.png)
![screenshot_20180709-005418](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26187363/42423191-047c470c-8314-11e8-9df9-b8110b69374c.png)



**Would you like to work on the issue?**
Yes i would like to work on this issue.

title: Fix for issue #1694 crash when sharing a image from gallery
body:
## Title 
App crashes when storage permission is not given and user tries to share a single image from gallery

Fixes 
#1694 

## Description (required)

Fixes #1694 {App crashes when storage permission is not given and user tries to share a single image from gallery}

The app was crashing so I added the code to grant permission when the user tries to share an image without previously giving storage permission. The app doesn't crashes now and asks the user to grant permission. When the user again tries to share the image after granting permission the app works and the image is uploaded.

## Tests performed (required)

Xiaomi Mi A1 (Android 8.0.0, API 26), with 2.7.2-debug-master~fa6353b3

title: Wikimania Hackathon Ideas
body:
Wikimedia's annual conference, [Wikimania](https://wikimania2018.wikimedia.org/) is happening in less than two weeks from now. 

Before the conference, there would be a two-day hackathon. It would be great if you could help in collating ideas for the hackathon. Bunch of small or tasks or a couple of medium sized tasks would be apt for the 2-day hackathon. 

I would be there and hopefully, more people from the Commons App community would be there too. :)

label: [Label(name="browsing"), Label(name="bug"), Label(name="gsoc 2018 browse")]
body:
- Search for category "apples"
- Open the "Apples by country" subcategory
- "Apples by country" does not show any subcategories (spinning forever)
- In fact it has many: https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/Category:Apples_by_country

title: Upload from category
label: [Label(name="browsing"), Label(name="categorization"), Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
The new browsing feature is the most powerful way to find categories.

Rather than selecting a picture first and then painfully searching for categories, how about easily selecting the category first using the browsing feature, and then selecting the picture?

It won't help if you must tag using several hard-to-find categories, but it is better than nothing, as pictures often have only one hard-to-find (very specific) category and other relatively easy to find categories.

This is outside of the scope for GSoC 2018.

title: Coordinates / no coordinates indicator on upload screen
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="metadata"), Label(name="privacy")]
body:
When my camera takes a picture, there is a small globe indicating whether I currently have a GPS fix or not.

It would be great if such an indicator was present on the upload screen too.

Cases where it would be useful:
- I took 10 pictures of a building, and when I start writing the title I realize that GPS info is not available. So I choose another of the 10 picture, with GPS info (when taking 10 pictures very often some picture have GPS info and some not)
- I take a picture of a rare 17th century book I have at home. When I start writing the title I realize that GPS info has been recorded. So I go back and pass the picture through Scrambled Exif before sharing it to the Commons app.

title: Implementation of in-app EXIF modification
label: [Label(name="privacy")]
body:
**Summary:** 

The app should implement a group of global setting for EXIF modification.

**Expected behaviour:** 

In the settings menu, there should be a setting to remove certain EXIF tags like camera model etc(#70, expansion of #1685 ) This is partially implemented in #1685.

There should be another setting to reduce location accuracy to 20km, 10km etc(#181) by giving slightly wrong coordinates. This could be done by removing decimal places but that would cause many pictures to have the exact same coordinate. Another option would be adding a random number to the coordinate but if a user took enough pictures from his house, averaging all the coordinates would give their location. This would allow the user to choose between different sensitivities of geotagging instead of removing the feature(#1644). 

Additionally, a UI to edit EXIF data of a specific image from the ShareActivity could be implemented but I'm not sure how much of the upload workflow would have to be changed for that.

Also, what could be done about making location and timing information available for endangered species through the same feature? (#182) 


**Screen-shots:** 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7621539/42169067-656ebe4e-7e1b-11e8-97c6-1d64eaa05146.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7621539/42169094-7a5660dc-7e1b-11e8-8127-2524a520e204.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7621539/42171168-4433b4fe-7e21-11e8-8a93-2e4230350011.png)


**Would you like to work on the issue?**

Yes.

EDIT:I clarified what reducing GPS accuracy is.

title: Fixes #212 - Remove from EXIF: copyright field (name)
body:
## Title (required)

Fixes #212 - Remove from EXIF: copyright field (name)

## Description (required)

Fixes #212 - Remove from EXIF: copyright field (name)

Implemented the modification of EXIF tags in class FileProcessor. The EXIF tags "Artist" and "Copyright" are modified to remove a specific string. This string is specified by the user in preferences. The function returns the URI of the new file. ShareActivity calls this function and passes the returned URI to the uploader. I also changed the behaviour of getPathOfMediaOrCopy. If redaction is enabled, getPathOfMediaOrCopy always makes a copy of the file. The path to this copy is stored in variable fileOrCopyPath and the function always returns this path.

## Tests performed (required)

Tested on API level 22, Genymotion Google Nexus 5 - 5.1.0 emulator, with build variant betaDebug

title: Force login when no active session is found while uploading an image
body:
## Title (required)

Fixes part of #1545. 

## Description (required)

The only could that could be null in the `startUpload` method of `UploadController` is `name` field of `CurrentAccount`. Have added a null check for the same and will be redirecting the user to login if the session is null. 

## Tests performed (required)

Unable to reproduce the issue but this check should ideally prevent the crash and redirect the user to login.

title: WMCZ project plan (Aug - Nov 2018) and release of v2.10
label: [Label(name="discussion")]
body:
There was another issue for this #865 , but that was written almost a year ago - the timeline and scope has changed since then and that issue has gotten rather long, so I figured that it would be best to get a fresh start.

WMCZ has kindly offered to fund the development of our app for a short period of time, and the new features/improvements that I would propose are below. These new features will be implemented by 3 part-time developers for an average of 11 weeks. We intend to start after our IEG renewal is completed - current estimate for IEG completion is late July with a final release of v2.9. This (WMCZ-funded) project will then run from Aug - Nov and culminate with a release of v2.10. (Future plans: we also intend to apply for a WMF-funded Project Grant which is due to start March 2019 if approved)

Feedback greatly appreciated from anyone, thanks! @VojtechDostal @nicolas-raoul @neslihanturan @maskaravivek 

### Nearby-related improvements
- **Tidy up code in entire Nearby package and write Javadocs for all Nearby classes and methods.** This will help allow new contributors to get started with this package, and will also provide a solid foundation for future Nearby improvements. If successful, we plan to iterate on this with other packages in the future. #1828 
- **Manual selection of Nearby search location:** "search in this area" button, and allow users to directly upload photos for items in that location. This will be essential for users who prefer to take photos first and then upload later (e.g. at home, on the bus, etc) #591 
- **Geocoordinate checking of photos uploaded via Nearby** to reduce risk of vandalism, especially after manual selection is enabled. If a user uploads a photo with a geotag that is far away from the location of the Nearby entity, prompt user to reconfirm. If they confirm that they want to perform the upload, allow the upload but do not edit the Wikidata item #945 

### Other new features
- **Show ongoing campaigns.** We could have a "news" section (perhaps in the main screen UI), so that users can see what Commons campaigns/competitions are going on at the moment. If this receives good user response, we might consider deeper campaign integration in the future. #78

### Tech improvements
These improvements are aimed at simplifying testing and debugging for the future. As demonstrated by the issues that we faced throughout our IEG renewal (e.g. Dagger crashes, failed uploads and Wikidata edits), we need to tighten the user testing/feedback loop to be notified more quickly when problematic code is merged, and we also need a better way of getting logs from users who are experiencing issues. The improvements below are my plans for fixing this problem, but other suggestions are most welcome.

- **Automate frequent app releases to a pool of testers.** This will allow us to find bugs/crashes early without time-consuming manual releases, and expand our options for volunteers for testing (since now non-technical folks can test the app without needing to wait for a release or for developers to send APKs to them). Two possible ways of doing this: (1) Create an alpha test track on Play Store and automate alpha testing, where releases are automatically pushed to alpha with each commit to master. (2) Use Fabric Beta to automate and distribute test releases. #1056  
- **Improve the "Send logs" feature.** In its current state, "send logs" is not very useful - the logs are not filtered for our app, and some logs that we receive don't contain anything from our app even after filtering. We need to investigate why this is happening and modify the feature (with filters) so that we can actually get useful logs from users. #1489 
- **Better handling of failed uploads.** In cases where we know the reason for a failed upload, we should mention it to the user (e.g. low connectivity, or not logged in, etc.).  We should also allow user to re-upload the photo (this feature currently exists but does not work a lot of the time). #1556 

### Misc
- Create a Medium blog for our app and try to get our blog included in the Wikimedia collection #1462 
- Release v2.10 containing all the improvements above and fix all issues with implementation

### Notes
- This plan is slightly more sparse with regards to new features per time than our current grant. The reason is that our current grant has taken 2+ months longer than estimated to complete, largely due to my underestimation of how long it takes to fix bugs and issues with each new feature. Based on our IEG renewal, I realized that more time needs to be allocated for bug fixes. Hopefully with this plan we will finish on time with a polished and non-buggy implementation, rather than running late. If we finish ahead of time, we will work on additional high-priority issues.
- A midpoint report and final report/blog post are factored into the time estimates.

title: Fix tamil translation of app name
body:
## Description (required)
The app name has been 'Commons' (and not 'Wikimedia Commons') for a
very long time. For completely unknown reasons, the Tamil (ta)
translation of the app name stuck with the translation for 'Wikimedia
Commons' regardless of the fact that the translation had been
corrected at translatewiki.net in the year 2016. The correction
somehow didn't reflect here during the localisation updates from
tranlsatewiki.net.

Ignoring the weirdness, correct the translation of the app name
to reflect it's current name.

"Give permissions" dialog in Nearby activity keeps flickering. You cannot select the "give permissions" option while it is doing that, and eventually it crashes.

This problem seems to occur in `master` branch. Actually, I'm testing PR #1672 , but that is based on master at the time of my testing, and that PR is unlikely to be the cause since there is no relevant change in that PR. body: I am not sure exactly how you want the Back arrow to behave and when it should be a Hamburger, but it seems inconsistent now, for instance sometimes pressing the Back arrow exits the whole app.

title: Hopping from category to category does not always work
label: [Label(name="browsing"), Label(name="bug"), Label(name="gsoc 2018 browse")]
body:
1. Go to featured images
2. Touch the first one (currently "Ryxö island nature reserve in Brofjorden")
3. Scroll down to its Categories section
4. Touch the first one ("Ryxö")
5. As expected, the category details activity for Category:Ryxö appears
6. Touch the first image (actually the same image)
7. Scroll down to its Categories section
8. Touch the second one ("Brofjorden")
9. Expected: The category details activity for Category:Brofjorden appears. Actually: The category details activity for Category:Ryxö appears.

title: Fixes  #1545 Top crashes on Play Store for v2.7.1 [A and E]
body:
## Description

Fixes A and E from #1545 (I hope). It saves file which is being uploaded to a temp location, and uses Uri of that file as reference during upload process, instead of using Uri that content provider supported.

## Tests performed (required)

Tested on API 23, beta debug. Tested actions: share photo from another application, share multiple photos from another application and contributing via contributions list.

title: Allow for settings titles to expand across multiple lines instead of being truncated
body:
## Expand settings title across multiple lines

Fixes #1670 

## Description

Allow for settings titles to expand across multiple lines instead of being truncated

Fixes #1670, Setting text is truncated when space is not available 

## Tests performed (required)

Tested on API level 24 on Samsung Galaxy S6, with ProdDebug.

## Screenshots showing what changed
Note that I only changed the setting title to show what a long title would look like. I reverted the title to the correct one before creating the pull request
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32438079/41988390-f1b6b5d4-7a09-11e8-8d56-2fea06dbc1e5.png)

title: Setting text is truncated when space is not available
body:
**Summary:** 
The settings text should not be truncated when space is not available as that leaves users with partial information which they cannot use to judge what the setting is actually for. This is especially a major issue for non-English languages where the translation might be longer and eventually gets truncated.

**Steps to reproduce:** 
1. Go to the Settings page on a small screen device

**Expected behavior:** 
The Settings text for 'Automatically get current location' should not be truncated.

**Observed behavior:** 
Part of the settings text is truncated.

**Device and Android version:** 
Samsung Galaxy j1 ace (5.1.1, 4.3")
 
**Commons app version:** 
2.7.2

**Screen-shots:** 
![screenshot_2018-06-27-19-38-15](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12448084/41979958-eeab5e42-7a42-11e8-94bb-a3636de73453.png)

**Would you like to work on the issue?**
No

**Note**
There was a [similar issue in the Wikipedia app](https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T192637) which [recently got fixed](https://gerrit.wikimedia.org/r/#/c/apps/android/wikipedia/+/427907/).

title: Nearby arrow marker issue #1452
body:
## Add direction the user is facing to Nearby real-time position

Fixes #1452
Fixes #1659

## Description (required)

Fixes #1452
Getting azimuth:
Data from sensors and screen rotation are collected in NearbyActivity and sent to CompassUtils (new class), static method computes azimuth taking into account rotation of device and swaping coordinate system if needed. After azimuth is computed it is send into NearbyMapFragment. 

Icon rotation:
I could not use Marker class which was used until now for current location marker. I had two options when implementing this. First was to change Marker to MarkerView and second use SymbolLayer which meant adding new layer to map and isolate icon on this layer where it can be rotated.

I discarded first option as MarkerView was depracted.

Using SymbolLayer meant slight changes to current location marker logic as layer does not have marker but only has icons and source set which contains positions of icons. 
These changes were changing current location marker from Marker to Feature, updating animator and evaluator for current location marker.
Fixes #1659
updating mapbox version to latest solved the issue
MapBoxTelemtery class was changed in latest versions. In code we had telemetry disabled. I used Telementry.disableOnUserRequest() to disable it. Reason for change was that old method is no longer static and this should do same thing. 

## Tests performed (required)

api 23, Samsung Galaxy J5 with betaDebug, prodDebug
api 26, emulator with betaDebug, prodDebug
api 23, emulator with betaDebug

In emulator map was broken with black squares appearing on map. It only appears in emulator, on smartphone map works as should without black squares. This error appeared between two test sessions and I believe it is not caused by my code as I tested master branch and map also had black squares. I did testing on mapbox 6.2.0 as master currently does not work due to #1659.

## Screenshots showing what changed (optional)
screenshot with black square on map
![screenshot_1529664916](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9913181/41848097-99c4d24a-787c-11e8-97d4-2e600313ed3a.png)

screenshot with arrow marker
![screenshot_1529666482](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9913181/41848100-9dfc0f18-787c-11e8-8251-1b583d6428c4.png)

title: CONTRIBUTING: link to a blog about good commit messages
body:
## Description (required)

Contributors who are interested in reading blog posts might find the linked blog post containing useful information about good commit messages. (They're really crucial.)

title: Using branch name tags for Github issues
label: [Label(name="discussion")]
body:
Our project has simultaneous active development happening on multiple branches. For eg. at the time of creating the issue `2.8-release`, `feedback-gamification`, `browse-commons-via-app` and `gamification` are active. Even the other branches in our repo are not exactly stale and would be merged in due course of time. 

Sometimes it's difficult to figure out which feature branch the issue is referring to. Moreover, external contributors won't have any idea that the issue might be talking about a feature branch. 

Can we have branch name tags mandated for our Github issues? This would also make finding issues for a particular feature branch easy. 

We can have this guideline added in the issue template if others agree to this proposal. :)

title: App shouldn't try to upload non-image files to commons
label: [Label(name="debated")]
body:
**Summary:** 
It is possible to try to share non-images using the app using certain external apps such as file managers. In that case the app doesn't clearly indicate to the user about why uploads of non-image files fail.

**Steps to reproduce:** 
1. Open a File explorer of your choice (e.g.) Amaze file manager.
2. Choose multiple files containing at least one image and a non-image file (.mp3, .md, .pdf, you name it)
3. Click on the 'Share' menu to share the chosen files
4. Choose the Commons app to share the files
5. Give a title for the upload set.
6. Tap on Upload (provide categories if you wish)

**Expected behavior:** 
The app shouldn't allow users to try uploading non-image files.

**Observed behavior:** 
The app allows users to try uploading non-image files. The upload of the non-image files fails. The upload of the images seems to succeed.

**Device and Android version:** 
Device: Samsung Galaxy j1 ace
OS: Android 5.1.1

**Commons app version:**
2.7.2 (beta flavour)

**Screen-shots:**
![screenshot_2018-06-22-00-01-33](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12448084/41738428-a5dd446a-75af-11e8-9d99-77f580070995.png)

**Would you like to work on the issue?**
No.

label: [Label(name="beginner friendly"), Label(name="bug")]

**Summary:** 
The app crashes when tapping on any of the images during a multiple upload before providing a title.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Open your favourite photo viewer or file manager.
1. Select multiple images
1. Click on 'Share'
1. Choose the 'Commons' app from the share menu that appears
1. In the Multiple Upload screen tap on one of the images before giving a title to the set of images

**Add System logs:**

Add logcat files here (if possible).

**Expected behavior:** 
App shouldn't crash but should provide a enlarged view of the image.

**Observed behavior:** 
App crashes.

**Device and Android version:**
OS: Android 5.1.1
Device: Samsung Galaxy j1 ace

**Commons app version:**
2.7.2 (beta line)

**Would you like to work on the issue?**
Nope.

title: Have a "helpful hints" expandable section at upload screen
label: [Label(name="discussion"), Label(name="user education")]
body:
There are a few inner workings of the app that are not immediately obvious to the casual user, I think. A few off the top of my head:

- Enabling geotagging on your camera is necessary to allow the app to attach location templates to your uploaded image and provide location-based category suggestions 
- If you mistakenly upload a wrong image, you can nominate it for deletion within the app by going to the media details view and selecting "nominate for deletion"
- Category selection is very important to ensure that your picture is usable in Wikipedia articles, because that is how people usually look for images to add to articles

So on and so forth. For desktop apps and games, a common tactic is to display "helpful hints" on the loading screen. We have no such option, so I figured that having an expandable section on the upload screen (or perhaps even underneath a contribution that is currently being uploaded) might be a good way of getting these across.

The main consideration IMO is that we don't want to clutter up our UI too much, and also that we have to maintain this to ensure that it keeps up with changes in the app.

title: Get rid of legacy URL
body:
This URL still works but intended as legacy.
As there are more separate API endpoints,
I've renamed the folder to commonsmisc to
enable me to add all endpoints to one folder
and to reduce potentional damage that can be caused
by fogotting the symlink is there for a reason,
I'm renaming it in the Commons app as well

**Steps to reproduce:** 

Click latest failed upload and try to cancel

title: Remove current location retrieval from upload process entirely
body:
Temporary fix for #1599 . We are concerned that people who enabled the "automatically get current location" setting prior to the subtext change may not realize that their location is being added to the image's location template. This removes current location retrieval entirely from the upload process, and removes the Setting as well.

Where possible, I have left methods intact so that in the future if we decide to reimplement this (retrieving current location solely for category suggestions but not adding it to the template), we will not need to rewrite code. However, I have removed most of the method calls, and methods that would affect the user (e.g. the snackbar requesting location permissions).

As an added bonus, this should fix #1515 since the LocationListener will not be registered in ShareActivity.

Tested on Nexus S emulator running API 25 on betaDebug. To test:
- Make sure GPS is on and your image has no geotagged coordinates
- Upload that image
- Check your uploaded image and make sure no location template was added to it

title: Refreshed listview after delete
body:
## Title (required)

Fixes #1633  (Crash when clearing search history twice )

## Description (required)
- refreshing listview on delete fixes this bug

## Tests performed (required)

Manually Tested on {API25 & MotoG5S+}, with { ProdDebug variant}.

title: Add a category details page in app
label: [Label(name="browsing"), Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
This is a child issue of #1221  
**Summary:** 
- The user should be able to view a category details page after searching categories / clicking on a particular category from a specific media.
- The details page should contain images, subcategories, (optional) link (icon to go to browser category page).

**Would you like to work on the issue?**
Yes, I will start working on this issue.

title: Fixes #1639 (Category search Added)
body:
## Add Search activity, image search feature Fixes #1639 (Add search categories from commons feature) Fixes #1652 (Ghost "No categories matching" message browsing bug) Fixes #1648 (ConcurrentModificationException at fr.free.nrw.commons.Media.setDescriptions) Fixes #1651 (No view found for id 0x7f0f00ad at fr.free.nrw.commons.explore.SearchActivity.onSearchImageClicked) ## Description - Search Category Fragment added which has a recyclerview to show search results (categories) - Made changes in Search Activity (added viewPagerAdapter, on text change notify search category fragment) - Implemented API to search Categories - SearchCategoryRenderer added (handles presentation of individual category) - Strings added - Onclick of category in search results, We are saving the search query to recent searches just like images. Once Category details page will be designed we will navigate it there. ## Tests performed Manually tested on [API 25 Motog5S+] with ProdDebug Please test on ProdDebug as betaDebug variant doesn't have many categories to search ## Screenshots showing what changed

title: Nearby  : Bind call too late - someone already tried to get: interface bghk -- metadata{ service_id: 0 }
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="nearby")]
body:
I get a lot of `Nearby  : Bind call too late - someone already tried to get: interface bghk -- metadata{ service_id: 0 }` lines.

Not sure if important or not. If it is expected, maybe we don't need to log it as a warning ?
Or is it a real problem?

title: Wikidata not edited when uploading from Nearby
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="nearby")]

Last weekend I went to a lot of places with Nearby as my guide.
In the Nearby screen, after touching +, I used both the camera button and the gallery button, with always the same result: No changes to Wikidata.

I am using [this commit](https://github.com/commons-app/apps-android-commons/commit/9f07c099089f73aa6133e7f09a8bc9729aef27df) of the [explore branch](https://github.com/commons-app/apps-android-commons/commits/browse-commons-via-app) which contains all commits from master, so I guess I should have wikidata edits (except if the explore branch has broken the wikidata feature, which is unlikely).

title: Fix crash while uploading image with whitespace title
body:
## Title (required)

Fixes #1635

## Description (required)

Fixes #1635

Trimmed the title before checking. 

## Tests performed (required)

Tested manually on the beta build.

title: Handle case where user uploads image with empty title (whitespace)
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
**Summary:** 

Try uploading an image with an empty title(only spaces) and description. App crashes on clicking next. 

**Add System logs:**

```

        at fr.free.nrw.commons.upload.UploadController$2.onPostExecute(UploadController.java:132)

**Expected behavior:** 

App should gracefully handle empty values. 

**Observed behavior:** 

App crashes!

**Device and Android version:** 

What make and model device (e.g., Samsung J7) did you encounter this on?  What Android
version (e.g., Android 4.0 Ice Cream Sandwich or Android 6.0 Marshmallow) are you running?  Is it
 the stock version from the manufacturer or a custom ROM ?
 
 **Commons app version:** 

You can find this information by going to the navigation drawer in the app and tapping 'About'

**Screen-shots:** 

Can be created by pressing the Volume Down and Power Button at the same time on Android 4.0 and higher.

**Would you like to work on the issue?**

Please let us know whether you want to fix the issue by yourself. If not, anyone can get the issue assigned to them.

title: Feature/localised image descriptions
body:
## Specify language when adding image descriptions 

Specify language when adding image descriptions #1501

## Description : 
Converted the descriptions edit text to a recycler veiw with and option to add description in various languages

## Tests performed :  
Open the app, click on the camera/gallery icon to upload an image, the next screen which would usually show an option to add a single description, would now let you add description in multiple languages (the default (first) one would be the device locale). Submit the request. After upload success, open the image description, I could now see description in my device current locale. 

Tested on {27l & name of Moto x, with {build variant,  ProdDebug}.

## Screenshots showing what changed (optional)

It will update the browse-commons-via-app branch with the new code in master in main repository.
I have fixed the conflicts.

title: Viewing a search result looses scroll position
label: [Label(name="browsing"), Label(name="bug"), Label(name="gsoc 2018 browse")]
body:
People who are looking for an image will probably:

1. Search for a string
2. Scroll until they see an image they might like, then view it, maybe download it if it is good, or otherwise:
3. Continue scrolling until they see an image they might like, then view it, maybe go back to scrolling
4. Etc, until they have found enough good images to be satisfied.

Problem: Currently, after viewing an image and pressing "Back", you are sent again to the top of the searches. So you have to scroll again to the position you had reached before.

title: Throbber visible below loaded images
label: [Label(name="browsing"), Label(name="bug"), Label(name="gsoc 2018 browse")]
body:

1. Go to featured images activity
2. Touch a picture to see its details
3. Press Back
4. You can see the throbbler (blue circle rolling) in the interstice between the two images, for like 1 or 2 seconds.

title: Correct name is "Wikidata", not "wiki data"

title: Redacting unwanted location information from file pages
body:
*This will not be done in Android code but a (Python) script that works on Wikimedia Commons. Comments are welcome. I plan to work on this alone, but if someone is interested, please contact me. (Since it's a one-off job and contains potentially sensitive data collected, I don't want to publish it in the repo.)*

In #1599 we agreed to redact file pages that contain location information published inadvertently. I'm working on redacting the information from file pages.

* [x] Create a list of the file pages whose first version contain a location template but no EXIF-embedded GPS data. (and categorized as uploaded via the app)
* [x] Create a list of the revisions where the first location information remains in those file pages
* [x] Prepare a sysop bot to perform the redaction (and get approval)
* [x] Edit and remove the first location information where it still remains in the latest version of the page
* [x] Redact the revisions from non-sysops
* [ ] Ask oversighters of Wikimedia Commons to redact the revisions from sysops (unnecessary?)
* [ ] Do above again for new (post-June) uploads
* [ ] Create a list of affected people and files and send a [mass message](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Help:Extension:MassMessage).

So far, it appears to involve 938 pages, 3294 revisions and 351 users.

title: Anonymous communication (Tor?)
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="privacy")]
body:
Our app uses HTTPS everywhere (I believe), preventing the bad guys from seeing the pictures/etc that Alice sends.
But the bad guys can totally see that Alice is uploading data to commons.wikimedia.org and from there get a hint and check the recently uploaded pictures.

A solution could be to allow Alice to use an anonymity technology (Tor? VPN?).
Because making all of her communications go through this anonymity technology might make her suspect, it might be a good idea to make only Commons data go through it. I believe that requires changing stuff in the app (if not please let us know by writing a guide in the wiki or as a comment below, thanks!)

A problem might be that Tor nodes are blocked from editing, advice from someone familiar with the topic would be appreciated, thanks! :-)

title: Change target API to 26
body:
Needs to be done by Nov 2018. From Play Store developer console:

> Warnings
> Your app currently targets API level 25 and must target at least API level 26 to ensure it is built on the latest APIs optimised for security and performance.
> 
> From August 2018, new apps must target at least Android 8.0 (API level 26).
> From November 2018, app updates must target Android 8.0 (API level 26).
> 
> Tip: Change your app's target API level. Learn how.

title: Build failed: Could not find common.jar
body:
**Summary:** 

Without change any code, I could not build android.

**Steps to reproduce:** 

I just clone and run 'gradlew.bat assembleDebug' on windows.

2.7.1-debug-master~db5d732a

I searched this problem and the answer of this problem is moving 'jcenter()' after maven in build.gradle file.
After moving 'jcenter()' I could build success.

title: Fixes#1580 Pagination added in imagesearch

## Fixes#1580 Pagination added in image search.

Fixes#1580 (Search results sometimes appear twice)

## Description (required)
- Added a parameter "sroffset" for getting list of images in search. (It helps in providing images after that offset)

Problem: After switching to a previous version, any attempt to start the app is met with this crash:

title: Display "what's new" popup the first time a user updates to new version
label: [Label(name="discussion"), Label(name="user education")]
body:
Most people don't read changelogs on the Play Store, especially if their apps are set to auto-update. Some apps get around this by having a "What's new?" popup the first time a user updates, displaying a summary of changes that users are likely to find interesting.

Thoughts on us doing this? Pros: Some of our new features aren't very easy to discover, so having them all in one place might increase adoption of new features by users. Cons: Some people might find it annoying, even if it only pops up once.

title: Make the use/lack of "File:" prefix explicit in variables storing file names
label: [Label(name="code-quality"), Label(name="discussion")]
body:
**Summary:** 

All Wikimedia Commons files have the "File:" in their titles on the website. We have variables called 'filename' everywhere in the source code which may or may not expect the prefix, which is confusing. I believe clarifying this will make our lives a little bit easier when using/modifying classes with these variables/methods.

Suggestions:

* Use `PageTitle` which has `getPrefixedText()` and `getText()` where appropriate.
* Update the documentation and make the expectation explicit.

title: Featured pictures: Show in recency or random order, rather than alphabetical order
label: [Label(name="assigned"), Label(name="browsing"), Label(name="bug")]
body:
Currently, featured pictures are shown in alphabetical order.

As a consequence, users will always see the same pictures.
In particular, nobody will ever see all of the featured pictures that do not start with a quote or digit character.
This is boring for users, they will not scroll featured pictures twice. Even in one year the pictures show will be the same, with 1 or 2 exceptions maybe among hundreds of pictures scrolled.

Solution: Rather than displaying in alphabetical order, show in either (only implement one, whichever you find easiest or have a personal preference for):
- Order of recent upload
- Order of recent nomination
- Or random

The order must be passed in the API request. Ordering results after receiving a result page is not a good solution.

title: Include peer review to app
body:
**Summary:** 

As you know, peer review #780 is roughly working. This issue will contain required steps to include it to our master codebase.

- UI: currently we used a viewpager and at each different question whole page swipes which is bad. I think the part of the page that includes question should move on next question, but image should stay still. 
- UI: Refresh button should change. I didn't think on a better UI yet.
- UI: Currently transitions between questions and new image is quite similar. But we have 2 different fuction and their transitions should feel different. First transition is when user answered a question about an image , new question comes. Second transition is whenever user requested another image or completed all questions with previous image, we give another image and start to ask questions from first question. My queestion is swiping is enough for first transition, however it could be better to add a fast forward animation for second transition.
- Compatibility: It would be nice if we can both play with random images and images that we searched for. So, this feature should be usable with images explored on explore feature. We can add them simultaneously. 

What do you suggest?

title: Gamification in general
body:
**Summary:** 

It seems like for long time we are planning to add some gamification to our app. And currently it is almost happening. So, I think it is good time to organize gamification.

**Accesibility:**
- I think adding separate items to navigation menu would look too complicated. Instead we can add an item for gamification in general. Under that item user can access to all fun stuff, example mockup:
![mock](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3127881/40588666-c389b4f0-61e9-11e8-8723-3da049991588.png)
- Also, it would be great if user can access to game via related activities. Ie. accessing review game via browse, featured and pic of the day activity, accessing statistics via contributions activity or accessing nearby game via nearby activity.

**UI:** 
I think we can do some experimental things since it is gamification and should be fun. Ie. using different colors from same color palette for each game, using more informal language, using more animations etc. But another important point each of them should feel common. They should have some common UI elements.

**Functionality:**
As I mentioned under accessibility, they should be compatible with other activities (like using share activity on share from nearby) 

What do you think?

title: Refactor ShareActivity
body:
Fixes #1091 . Tested by uploading via app and "share" on prodDebug build, real device running Android 7.0.

Changes made:
- ~~Directed all upload entry points to ShareActivity. MultipleShareActivity.java will be removed completely in a future PR~~ This redirection cannot be done yet if we are to release 2.8 with this PR.
- Added Javadocs to methods of ShareActivity
- Reduced number of lines in ShareActivity from 1000+ to 600+ by extracting file processing functions to FileProcessor.java (if they made sense to be associated with an object) or to FileUtils.java (if they made sense to be static), and extracting zoom functions to Zoom.java.
- Unified the FileUtils in Upload package and the FileUtils in Utils package, as there is no point in having 2 different FileUtils and it was causing a lot of confusion
- Simplified permission logic in ShareActivity, there is no point having storage permissions requested in the snackbar as well as at the Submit button, as it is mandatory. The snackbar is now used solely for the optional Location permission
- Removed as much unnecessary code as possible from onCreate(), reducing number of lines by more than half

title: Review: don't dump whole RC list when first nominated for delete
Error handling for review image/category fetch
More random recent image selection
body:
time-based randomness is biased - if someone uploaded 100 images in
hour, one week ago, and I select a random point in time, their last
image is way more likely to come up than anything else.

With this, there is still bias towards choosing one of the last N
in any burst of uploads (where N is the number of recent changes
fetched) but it's a bit better than before.

title: Enable crosswiki notifications and minor UI fixes in displaying notif…
body:
This PR enables crosswiki notifications so that some of the wikidata and wikipedia notifications(currently thank you edits) can be seen in the app. 

Moreover, it does quite a few UI fixes:
- removes whitespace from the beginning of a notification
- shows appropriate notification icon, fetching it from the server
- parses HTML string to show unescaped string

Notifications page now looks much better :)

title: Wikidata Toolkit usage in our project
label: [Label(name="discussion")]
body:
**Summary:** 

Wikidata Toolkit tea came yesterday and said it can be beneficial for us to switch using toolkit (if it is possible technically (Java versions compatibility can be a pain)) for our Wikidata integration.  Currently we don't have too much to do with Wikidata but in near future we can include some cool staffs and a toolkit could be really beneficial. What does team think?

title: Add a message about why we logged out people
label: [Label(name="UX - user experience"), Label(name="discussion")]
body:
**Summary:** 

According to feedback from users we have to inform them why we logged out them after last release. We can include a message about this.

title: Commit template verificator
label: [Label(name="discussion"), Label(name="tests")]
body:
**Summary:** 

We frequently experiences some problems on commit title and description templates. Instead of manually fixing them we can automatize it with a great tool by @refeed (one of our contributors), here is the code: https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/project/profile/2163/ 

I think we should definitely start to use it and he also offers to send related PR himself. What do you think team?

title: Easy to copy/paste copyright/license text
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="media details"), Label(name="user education")]
body:
Browsing Commons is often done for the purpose of using an image (for instance to paste into a blog article).

When using an image, the license must be stated, and the author's name, depending on the license. It is not obvious, so we should help users have the right license/etc notice. We can generate it automatically from the media's metadata and show it to the user in her language, in a textbox or something that can be easily copied from.

![bateau_pirate _yasmina_tunisie _juin_2013](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/99590/40241483-1bd65d34-5af6-11e8-9e4e-16419aba71e1.jpg)
Picture by Habib M’henni / Wikimedia Commons under license CC-BY-SA 3.0 at https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Bateau_pirate,_Yasmina_Tunisie,_juin_2013.jpg

title: Inform users about the freedom of panorama depended on country
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="user education")]
body:
There are countries where one is not allowed to take pictures of public spaces and publish them, see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Freedom_of_panorama .

Users should be informed about this copyright issue depending on their current geo location (country) or the geo location of the image they upload.

title: Rebase wikidata edits branch with master
body: Rebasing `wikidataEdits` with `master`

title: Allow user to set any image as wallpaper using Commons app
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
It would be great if we give the users an option to set an image as their phone's wallpaper. With exploring, featured images and picture of the day there would be plenty of good images that the user might want to use as a wallpaper. 

I can think of two places where this option could be there:
- media detail fragment, to allow the user to set that image as wallpaper
- Settings page: This could be a slightly different option that lets the user tick a checkbox and then every day we can update his wallpaper with that day's picture of the day.
