title: Make download button more visible?
label: [Label(name="UX - user experience"), Label(name="browsing"), Label(name="media details")]
body:
The Download button of the media details activity is currently in the overflow menu, which is known to be a place users rarely see.

While it was perfect for an upload-centric application, now the app is getting more browsing features so downloading an image from Commons might become the most-common use case of the app.

So, I believe the download button should be made more visible.
What do you all think?

title: Implement Google Assistant for nearest location needing pictures, browsing, uploads, etc
body:
**Summary:** 

Was just wondering if it would be cool to launch the upload flow in the Commons app directly from Google assistant. I can't think much about what all actions could be performed using the assistant launcher but it would surely be a novelty feature to have. 

The basic action that I can think of is: 

"Hey, Google! Upload photo on Commons"
 
**Would you like to work on the issue?**

Yes. Have worked on a couple of assistant apps in the past and it would be a cool thing to work on. :D

title: enhancement/issue-#1508
body:
Fixes#1508 "please check your password" -> "please check your username and password"

-changed string resources login_failed_username and login_failed_username to "please check your username
and password"

Change improves security of the login process.

Tested on Nexus 5X API 23 emulator, with betaDebug build

title: Fix for issue #1508
body:
Made changes to the error message displayed when user enters wrong login credentials.
Changed "Unable to login - Please check your username" to "Unable to login - Please check your username and password".
Changed "Unable to login - Please check your password" to "Unable to login - Please check your username and password".

Changed to a common error message string for the two cases where user either entered a wrong username or a wrong password to reduce the work for translators.

title: Inform user when she is blocked
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
**Summary:** 

We can inform user with a snackbar displayed at the bottom of each activities as "You are blocked from editing commons". 

This can be done at our AuthenticadedActivity class (since all authenticaded classes extends it) to prevent rewriting same code again and again for all acitivites.

title: Pressing "Back" in zoom activity leaves app
label: [Label(name="beginner friendly"), Label(name="bug"), Label(name="metadata")]
body: instead it should just exit zoom

title: Zoom screen leaves title/description text fields
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="metadata")]
body:
The cursor is even blinking in the title field.
They should be hidden or at least the cursor made not blink, as entering text is impossible at this step.

title: "please check your password" -> "please check your username and password"
label: [Label(name="beginner friendly"), Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="high priority")]
body:
This error message comes up when entering a username that does not exist on that server:
![39871665-3c00742e-5483-11e8-872a-027587c7dc9a](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/99590/39903316-928da372-550d-11e8-87f4-b9f8c0fe6d1d.png)

Because of [security](https://security.stackexchange.com/a/17820/634), we should not say which (username or password) is wrong, but we should change the message to "please check your username and password".

title: Disable list option in Nearby until nearby places are loaded
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="nearby")]
body:
**Summary:** 
It isn't useful to show the "List" icon in the Nearby screen until nearby places have loaded. It just shows a blank screen. It would better to disabling the button until the nearby places have been loaded. The state of the list icon could even serve as an indicator for when nearby places have been loaded.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Ensure you're in a slow internet connection
1. Go to *Nearby* and ensure nearby places haven't loaded (due to the slow internet connection)
1. Tap on the "List" icon

**Expected behavior:** 
The icon is disabled as it's not of use until nearby places have been loaded.

**Observed behavior:** 
A blank list is shown.

**Device and Android version:** 
*Device*: Galaxy J2
*Android*: 5.1.1
 
**Commons app version:** 
2.7.1

**Screen-shots:** 
![screenshot_2018-05-10-23-38-36](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12448084/39888378-3ed4df6c-54b2-11e8-96b9-f2bf9a91ce23.png)


**Would you like to work on the issue?**
Only if I had enough memory on my laptop to feed Android studio, Emulator and Firefox all at the same time :relaxed:

title: App crashes when opening *Nearby* in a particular scenario
label: [Label(name="assigned")]
body:
**Summary:** 
*Nearby* crashes when the phone is connected to a network that is disconnected from the ISP's network. To be more detailed, I use a Wi-Fi enabled data modem with the ability to disconnect the data service. So, when I disconnect the data service and connect the phone to the Wi-Fi network (which isn't connected to the ISP's network) and visit *Nearby*, the app crashes.

**Steps to reproduce:** 
1. Connect to a network that isn't connected to the ISP's network in some way (one way is described in the summary)
1. Open the app
1. Open *Nearby*

**Add System logs:**
```
D/NearbyPlaces: java.net.ConnectException: failed to connect to query.wikidata.org/192.168.206.84 (port 443): connect failed: ECONNREFUSED (Connection refused)
D/NearbyPlaces: back to initial radius: 1.000000
W/System.err: io.reactivex.exceptions.OnErrorNotImplementedException: Callable returned null
W/System.err:     at io.reactivex.internal.functions.Functions$OnErrorMissingConsumer.accept(Functions.java:704)
W/System.err:     at io.reactivex.internal.functions.Functions$OnErrorMissingConsumer.accept(Functions.java:701)
W/System.err:     at io.reactivex.internal.observers.LambdaObserver.onError(LambdaObserver.java:74)
W/System.err:     at io.reactivex.internal.operators.observable.ObservableObserveOn$ObserveOnObserver.checkTerminated(ObservableObserveOn.java:276)
W/System.err:     at io.reactivex.internal.operators.observable.ObservableObserveOn$ObserveOnObserver.drainNormal(ObservableObserveOn.java:172)
W/System.err:     at io.reactivex.internal.operators.observable.ObservableObserveOn$ObserveOnObserver.run(ObservableObserveOn.java:252)
W/System.err:     at io.reactivex.android.schedulers.HandlerScheduler$ScheduledRunnable.run(HandlerScheduler.java:109)

title: Combined upload
body: Based on designs shared in #1128, this code introduces a new `UploadActivity` that aims to replace the old Share / Multi-Share activities.  As mentioned in #1091, this is a work in progress but should help get things started.

title: In the gallery, mark some images as "TODO"
label: [Label(name="categorization"), Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="gallery"), Label(name="metadata")]
body:
I am not sure how to word this, but in a user's uploads gallery we could display a kind of "TODO" icon that shows images that might be targets for improvement.

That would provide something to do to users who just open the app without having a picture to upload.

Possible improvements:
- Add a description (if none has been entered)
- Add a latitude/longitude (if none has been entered)
- Add categories (if none has been entered)

The user should be able to discard the TODO, for instance a picture of a smartphone taken in my home does not need latitude/longitude.

title: Specify language when adding image descriptions
label: [Label(name="assigned"), Label(name="beginner friendly"), Label(name="enhancement")]
body: Descriptions on Wikimedia Commons are usually multilingual. Specifying the language of description is considered important and is basically mandatory in the official Commons uploader. However our app does not currently enable specification of language. There could be a roll-out menu like I show below: The technical implementation into resulting Commons pages is then rather simple. The descriptions are encased in language templates like this one (for English description): {{en|PLACEHOLDER TEXT OF DESCRIPTION}}. If we want, we could even allow users to add several descriptions, in any number of languages. The descriptions are then just added one after another like this: {{en|PLACEHOLDER TEXT OF DESCRIPTION}}{{cs|Another description but now in Czech}}.

title: Zoom even more
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
The zoom feature in the description activity is already a very useful addition!

As a low-priority issue, I just noticed that it could be improved by allowing the user to zoom to the full definition of the picture. Right now only shows a sub-sampled version of the picture.

Here is what I get when I **zoom at maximum**:
![screenshot_20180507-184631](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/99590/39697222-1df3114e-522b-11e8-9585-8d617d2616d8.png)

... for [this picture](https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Building_that_hosts_the_Salt_Science_Research_Foundation.jpg) of which here is a detail:

![screenshot from 2018-05-07 19-17-46](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/99590/39697289-66b3dabc-522b-11e8-82ab-199157f5359d.png)

See how the line under the characters, and the characters themselves, are much clearer on the original.
Zooming more would allow the user to see what is written, and thus enter a more accurate description.

title: Letting users bookmark a nearby location for offline use
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="nearby")]
body: Just letting users bookmark/save a nearby location would be a good idea. Sometimes while browsing I see a few nearby places that I would like to visit and click a picture and then upload the image. Having an option to bookmark such places locally would be great so that users can simply pull out that list and then navigate to that place. The local list could be shown in the same Nearby page(using a toggle or an action bar option) or could be a hamburger item (eg. Saved places)

title: Fix security exception crash while accessing network location provider
body:
## Description

Fixes #1480

The app was not asking for permissions before subscribing to location updates from the network provider. This was leading to a security exception. 

## Tests performed

Unable to reproduce the crash using the steps mentioned in the issue. 

@neslihanturan @misaochan Can you guys help in testing if its reproducible on your end.

title: [WIP] Rewrite of the API layer
body:
## Description

This PR move us most of the way toward a rewrite of the API layer of the app with a couple of goals
* Move off the deprecated Apache based libraries and consolidate onto a single networking library (OkHttp)
* Move off the deprecated XML based mediawiki api and to using the JSON based mediawiki api

The work is *not complete* but I wanted this in the team's hands sooner rather than later!  Aiming to merge to a centralized feature branch to continue the work.

## Tests performed

At this point it's possible to log into the app (beta and prod variants) and view your contributions.  I only have a single "useful" notification so testing loading those was a little sketchy, so it would be great if someone else could take a look.  There are a couple of gaps in the API still needing to be filled in; manual testing will fail if you bump into a `// TODO` comment on an unimplemented method.

## Still to do

Look at the `// TODO` comments in the code - there are a couple of spots still to fill in.  I've not tackled upload yet, but got some of the infrastructure in place for someone to be able to fill that in.  It's going to need a little creativity to pull *progress notifications* from the OkHttp upload.

~The modeling of responses is another area for refactoring to better adhere to the Open/Closed principle; infrastructure is in place to be able to return something other than my initial `ApiResponse` class, just now need to break it up a little.~  ✅ **Done**

Also missing is Javadoc.  Yeah, about that.  😉

title: Modify the "Send Logs" feature
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
The "send logs" feature in its current state (2.7.1) is not very useful. As mentioned at #1485 , there are two issues with it:

1. The buffer size seems to be very small, we get relatively few lines of logs compared to what Android Studio etc can store. We likely need to increase this.
2. We are getting a lot of unrelated logs from system etc. We need to filter our app's logs out if possible. @tanvidadu has suggested a method for this: 

> To filter out logcats https://stackoverflow.com/questions/17448912/using-grep-command-to-filter-logcat-in-android?utm_medium=organic&utm_source=google_rich_qa&utm_campaign=google_rich_qa this might help.

title: Upload fails often in 2.7
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="high priority")]
body:
Report from user on googlegroups
He says "Very often: Upload failed"

And has logs attached. Unfortunately I can't share them here without permission, but anyone who has signed the NDA that allows them to access our private group is welcome to check it there.

There are two issues here:

1. The logs don't provide any meaningful information. It is completely cluttered by system logs, etc. This has been the case for logs provided by everyone else as well. Is it at all possible for us to filter for our app's logs programmatically in the "send logs" feature?

2. The upload failing very often. I plan to ask him where he is uploading from (sd card, etc), and for screenshots if he can provide them. What other information do you guys think would be useful to solve the problem? @maskaravivek @psh @nicolas-raoul @neslihanturan 

He isn't the only one with it - a recent Play Store review was from a user who encountered the same problem. So I would probably assign this issue a fairly high priority since this is our core functionality.

title: Update issue_template.md
body: It feels like the template for reporting bugs is a bit redundant - we have summary, steps to reproduce, observed behaviour AND expected behaviour, which all are very similar. I think that by paring it down to the essentials, people will be less likely to skip steps.

title: Set up sign in credentials for Google Play pre-launch report
label: [Label(name="discussion"), Label(name="pre-release")]
body:
The Google Play pre-launch report in the dev console seems to be a huge help - we can upload a beta or alpha version and have it click through to test for crashes etc on various devices.

The main reason this doesn't work for us is that our app is mostly blocked behind a sign-in wall. However, I just read that it can be given sign-in credentials: https://support.google.com/googleplay/android-developer/answer/7002270

Is it a good idea to create a "test" username and password to use for this purpose? @nicolas-raoul We also have to consider that there is a good chance that it will upload crap, so we can only test on beta servers I think.

title: Create video of people using the new Nearby feature for Play Store
label: [Label(name="hackathon 2018"), Label(name="publicity")]
body:
I was thinking that it would be nice if we could create a video of people (preferably a diverse group of people) walking around on a photo trip around the area, using the new Nearby feature and uploading pictures through it. We could post this video on our Play Store listing, as well as on blogs etc.

Perhaps this year's hackathon would be a good place to do it? @neslihanturan what do you think? Is anyone else here attending? It would be great if we could rope in an experienced videographer to help, too, like John Lubbock did in the last hackathon. :)

title: We dont have a published 'code of conduct' document
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
I took a look at our Github “Community Profile” (https://github.com/commons-app/apps-android-commons/community) which highlights that our project doesn’t have a published code of conduct.  Digging a little deeper there’s a suggestion that the “Contributor Covenant” (see: https://www.contributor-covenant.org/) might be a good starting point.

I read through it and it seems to have been adopted by a large number of solid open-source projects and I don’t see anything I’d object to.  How does everyone feel about adopting it for our project?

title: Start a Medium dev blog and add it to Wikimedia publication?
label: [Label(name="discussion"), Label(name="publicity")]
body:
I just found out about https://medium.com/freely-sharing-the-sum-of-all-knowledge/ from looking at the GSoC community bonding page. From what I can gather, it seems that Medium works by having "Collections" or "Publications" of relevant blogs, similar to [Planet Wikimedia](https://meta.wikimedia.org/wiki/Planet_Wikimedia). However, the Medium collection seems to have more traction and readers than Planet Wikimedia from what I can see.

I wonder if it would be worth starting a dev blog on Medium, and asking the Wikimedia curators if they wouldn't mind adding us? It feels a bit like duplication of effort, since I already post updates on my Wordpress blog, which is part of Planet Wikimedia. But it might be worth it. The [web dev team](https://medium.com/freely-sharing-the-sum-of-all-knowledge/why-it-took-a-long-time-to-build-that-tiny-link-preview-on-wikipedia-d5bd734df8fe) seems to do the same duplication.

Thoughts? From those familiar with Medium (@maskaravivek ?) as well as those familiar with Wikimedia publicity (@VojtechDostal and @nicolas-raoul ?).

After the changes in how the `authCookie` is stored and used after the 2FA changes, we are forced to log out the user if he is coming from an older version. This PR checks for the cached values and if those values are not present, the user is asked to login again.

title: Add direction the user is facing to Nearby real-time position
label: [Label(name="assigned"), Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="nearby")]
body:
AFAIK there was a discussion about this somewhere, but I think it was buried under a more general discussion.

Currently, our users see their real-time position as a dot. Which is great! But it would be much more useful if they could see what direction they were facing, similar to popular map apps. IMO this would make it easier for users to navigate using our Nearby map, without implementing full-on routing.

A brief look at how we can do that: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/14611493/point-arrow-to-direction-the-user-is-facing

title: Require Javadocs for all new methods and classes?
label: [Label(name="code-quality"), Label(name="discussion")]
body:
In our current state, I think our code is still somewhat difficult for a new contributor to get started with. A big part of the reason IMO is insufficient Javadocs. Ideally, I feel that every method and class should have Javadocs, at least brief ones. In that way, people who are unfamiliar with the codebase can get a headstart instead of trying to puzzle out from scratch what method does what.

My question to other collaborators: What do you guys think about requiring Javadocs for all NEW methods and classes that are submitted via PR? After all, the best person to write a Javadoc is the person who created the method/class. This won't fix all of the existing code, but would be a good start. After we have started this, then we can slowly start going through the existing code and adding Javadocs to them.

Thoughts? If everyone is on board with this, we can add this requirement to the pull request template and to beginner documentation, and when we review PRs we should ask them to add Javadocs if needed. There may be a bit of an adjustment period at the start (I personally make the mistake of not writing them sometimes!), but I firmly believe this will be beneficial if we stick it out.

title: Add filters to Nearby
label: [Label(name="discussion"), Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="nearby")]
body:
This was inspired by #618 , but I decided to create a new issue as this is a much more general suggestion.

I wonder if it would be a good idea to have filters where people can filter out certain types of Nearby items. The most obvious usage would be for the "instanceOf" label, where someone could say they wanted "historic sites" or "suburbs" etc specifically, and only see those pins on the map. And of course, for the items that don't exist anymore, as per #618 . Maybe even filter for items that have or don't have Wikipedia articles, etc?

This would likely need to be done alongside #591 , as currently our range and location of pins is a bit restrictive.

title: Code cleanup + automated testing around GPS Categories
body:
## Description

The PR was inspired by trying to get some good unit tests around the loading of GPS categories.  There was an awful lot going on in the API class, particularly 
* An embedded (static) class acting as a shared model (tough for testing)
* Inner classes modeling the JSON returned by the Mediawiki Json API 
* The `toString()` method was the trigger to do data extraction - categories were being processed as a result of a **Log statement**.

**Changes made:**

* The `CategoryApi` and associated `GpsCategoryModel` classes now adhere to the [single responsibility principle](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Single_responsibility_principle)
* The categories loaded as a result of the GPS query are now held in a shared model -`GpsCategoryModel` - injectable where needed using Dagger.
* In the process of cleaning things up I consolidated us from 3 HTTP libraries (Volley, OkHttp and the deprecated Apache HTTP library) down to 2 (OkHttp and the deprecated Apache library).
* The modeling of some small part of the Mediawiki Json API has been extracted - we can build on that as we move the app over to more of the Json API.
* Tests were created around the newly extracted classes

## Tests performed

The app was tested using the _prod_ variant, as there's better data available.  Categories loaded asynchronously as expected.  Unit tests were added to the suite.

title: Link in "This image will be licensed ..." is too sensitive
label: [Label(name="beginner friendly")]
body:
Summary:  The link attached to the whole sentence "This image will be licensed under Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0" is too sensitive and easily could be accidentally clicked and also it is not obvious that it is a link.  Maybe it would be better if we will attach the link only to specific words like "Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0", like in the case with words "Wikimedia Commons policies" at the same screen where it is obvious that is a link. 

Steps to reproduce:
1. Dowload the (Beta) app from the Play Store
2. Try to upload a picture from your gallery

Expected behavior: Not to be so sensitive.  Maybe attach the link only to the specific word like Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0.  For instance, at the same screen there exist another link which is attached to the words "Wikimedia Commons policies".   

Observed behavior: When you are typing the "Title" and "Description" the half of the screen is closed with the keyboard, and you can not see what is on the second half so you scroll down and your finger each time accidentally touches this linked sentence and a new window opens in the browser. 

Device: Sony Xperia XA Ultra
Android version: 7.0
Commons app version: Version 2.7.0

Screen-shots: 
![photo5375128468771154177](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17812648/38773019-584b9a82-4065-11e8-9723-26eeec012250.jpg)

title: Fix security exception (Nearby places not loading after permissions granted)
body:
Work in progress

I have been attempting to fix #1413 and have partially succeeded. Now, after granting permissions, the Nearby points load. I think the issue with the previous attempts was that when permissions were granted, we did not check for the last known location and so `refreshView()` returned prematurely with the below code:

```
        if (curLatLang == null) {
            Timber.d("Skipping update of nearby places as location is unavailable");
            return;
        }
```

title: Map centers camera to your current location marker at a random moment
label: [Label(name="debated")]
body:
Summary: 
The center of the map goes back automatically to your location marker at random moment during your manipulations with the map

Steps to reproduce:
1. Download the (Beta) app from the Play Store
2. Go to Nearby
3. Center the camera of the map somewhere away from your location marker
4. Start continuously tapping the screen from marker to marker, or just tapping the screen of the map.(with a delay of 1-2 sec)
5. You will notice how the center of the map goes back automatically to your location marker
 
Expected behavior: 
Center the map to my location marker only in the case when I press the specific white circle button on the top right corner of the screen 

Observed behavior:
Center of the map goes back automatically to your location marker at random moment during your manipulations with the map, like tapping from marker to marker.  

Device: Sony Xperia XA Ultra
Android version: 7.0
Commons app version: 2.7.0

Would you like to work on the issue?
No, I am a Tester

title: Case when the button that opens Google Maps do nothing
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="nearby")]
body:
Summary: 
In case if you first open the list of nearby places, and there chose the place and press the button that opens  Google Maps and then try to choose mark from the map and press there the same button it will do nothing. 

Steps to reproduce:
1. Download the (Beta) app from the Play Store
2. Go to Nearby
3. Open the list of nearby places
4. Choose place and press there the button that opens the Google Maps (it will always work fine)
5. Choose any mark on the map
6. Press the button for opening google map , it will do nothing 

Expected behavior:
I expected that Google Maps will be opened and it will show me the right coordinates of the object that I chose on the application's map,

Observed behavior: The button will do nothing

Device: Sony Xperia XA Ultra
Android version: 7.0
Commons app version: 2.7.0

Screen-shots:
Open the list of nearby places. Choose place and press there the button that opens the Google Maps (it will always work fine)
![img_20180414_014944_344](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17812648/38755109-5b7e08dc-3f86-11e8-8f4a-fdb3723bbe35.jpg)

Below is a screenshot of the button that does not work. Choose any mark on the map. Press the button for opening google map , it will do nothing 
![img_20180414_012231_405](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17812648/38755086-41feac36-3f86-11e8-937b-abc852e08580.jpg)


Would you like to work on the issue?
No, I am a Tester

title: button that opens Google Maps shows always only the coordinates of the first chosen mark
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="high priority"), Label(name="nearby")]
body:
Summary:
When you choose any mark from the map the corresponding button that opens  Google Maps shows always only the coordinates of the first chosen mark. 

How can we reproduce the issue?
1. Download the (Beta) app from the Play Store
2. Go to Nearby
3. Choose any mark on the map
4. Press the button for opening google map (labeled it on the screenshot)

Expected behavior: 
I expected that Google Maps will be opened and it will show me the right coordinates of the object that I chose on the application's map,

Observed behavior:
 however, it shows it correct only for the first time. When you will try to look at the coordinates of the other objects, it will always show you the coordinated of the first chosen mark. 

(By the way, the same button from the list of nearby objects works fine)

Device: Sony Xperia XA Ultra
Android version: 7.0
Commons app version: 2.7.0

Screen-shots:
![img_20180414_012231_405](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17812648/38754228-c3e418f2-3f82-11e8-928e-741ecd63f658.jpg)

Would you like to work on the issue?
No, I am a Tester

title: list icon allows user only to show the list , but not to make it disappear
body:
Summary:
I expected that by pressing the icon the list of nearby places will appear and if I will press this icon again the list will disappear. However, once the list appears future pressing on this icon will do nothing.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Download the (Beta) app from the Play Store
2. Go to Nearby
3. Press the icon for viewing the list

Expected behavior:
I expected that by pressing the icon the list of nearby places will appear and if I will press this icon again the list will disappear.

Observed behavior: 
I can press the icon for showing the list of nearby places, but once the list appears future pressing on this icon will do nothing. I was confused about how I can get rid of the list and go back to the full-screen map. It is not intuitively obvious to a user, that we need to slide the list downward in order to get rid of it. I think that it would be better if we will also add the icon feature that will allow a user not only to show the list but also to make it disappear.

Device: Sony Xperia XA Ultra
Android version: 7.0
Commons app version: 2.7.0

Screen-shots:
![img_20180413_223856_852](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17812648/38747110-8c85d36c-3f6b-11e8-9138-709f676eaf4e.jpg)

Would you like to work on the issue?
No, I am a Tester

title: Rotating the screen while logged in redirects the user to the "create an account" page.
body:
#### Expected behavior It is expected that on rotating the screen from portrait to landscape, a user should still be able to go on using the app from the landscape view and not get redirected to create an account when already you have one created and you are logged in to the account. #### Actual behavior The app on rotation redirects you back to the **create an account** page even when you are already logged in. #### How to reproduce * Download the app from fdroid store * Scroll through your menu and launch app. * Sign up with your desired user details * Log in with these details * On the user dashboard or homepage, attempt rotating the phone screen from portrait to landscape. You will notice this action redirects you to the **create an account** page. *** * Device: TECNO-L8Plus * Operating system: Android 5.1 * Application: Commons * version: 2.7.0 #### Recording Of The Bug
https://youtu.be/n57UzNWdMDE

Posted on Utopian.io - Rewarding Open Source Contributors

title: Moved test suite over to Kotlin.
body:
## Description

Related to the discussion on issue #1389, this PR moves the Java unit test suite over to Kotlin.

Changes of note:

* Updated the version of Kotlin to match the latest release (*note:* Kotlin is still only a test dependency, so not enabled for use in the production codebase)
* Slight change of order in the `build.gradle` dependencies to tidy things up.
* Utilized the more idiomatic [Mockito-Kotlin](https://github.com/nhaarman/mockito-kotlin) (MIT licensed) in tests.

## Tests performed

All unit tests, across all build variants, run cleanly.

title: Fix blank categories in direct Nearby uploads

To test, upload to an item in Nearby list or map that doesn't have Commons categories. No blank category should be shown in category selection screen.

Tested with Nexus S API 25

title: Hot fix bundle issue
body:
## Description

Fixes #1416 
Sending bundles from fragment to activity handled with a method instead of setBundle method, since it is illegal to call setBundle method on an already created fragment. I couldnt reproduce the bug but, this should solve the issue.

## Tests performed

Tested on API 19, manual test

Fixes #1420

Tested on Nexus S emulator on API 25.

To test this, clear storage permissions and then try direct uploading from Nearby map or list. After you approve permissions, it should take you directly to the gallery or camera.

Fixes #1395 

Re-submitting PR #1422

title: Wikipedia link in Nearby map should be localized based on user's default language
label: [Label(name="beginner friendly"), Label(name="localization"), Label(name="nearby")]
body:
Latest version of the app brings a 'detailed view' for items in the Nearby map which also includes a Wikipedia button that goes to a corresponding article. However the button does not work in some cases even when Wikipedia article is clearly available. I suspect this is because the app only loads English Wikipedia, no matter what the language settings are.

It would be cool if we could prefer links to native language Wikipedia. If not available, then we should link to English. If English is unavailable too, we might link to other Wikipedias ordered by size.

title: Change email address for logs to private mailing list
body:
As mentioned at #891 , WMF has pretty strict rules about how we maintain user privacy if we are to remain on their Play Store account. When the user taps "send log file" in Settings, they should be sending the file to the private forum (only accessed by devs who have signed the NDA), not the public one.

This is the 3rd time I have needed to make this change, as it keeps being overridden :( (see #974 and #1000). I have modified the variable names and removed header sharing with the feedback option to be even more explicit. Please please be aware of this.

title: Kotlin for the tests
label: [Label(name="continuous integration"), Label(name="question"), Label(name="tests")]
body:
**Summary:**

It has been our stated strategy that we would evaluate the use of Kotlin by using it for writing tests.

**Expected behavior:** 

New tests would be written using Kotlin & our test coverage would increase.

**Observed behavior:** 

1. Very few tests seem to be created, whether Java or Kotlin.
2. We leave the CI build broken & don't actively maintain the test suite
3. We don't utilize Kotlin (cf #1371 - we could have / should have offered guidance that New tests be in Kotlin for the Nearby failures)

**Device and Android version:** 

One thing to note: we should update the version of Kotlin in our project.

**Would you like to work on the issue?**

I would be happy to Port the _entire_ suite to Kotlin, for sure, including new ones for Nearby **but** this needs to be a team buy-in ... are we "in" or "out" of the Kotlin game?  If we are "in" is there a more effective strategy for adoption?

title: Version Control: Using squash merge when merging PRs to master
body:
In my opinion, when we merge PRs, we should be squashing the commits before merging it. A PR is usually related to one logical change as: 
- during the course of development, developers usually keep creating commits after small changes
- whenever a PR is reviewed, new commits are made to address issues pointed in reviewer's comments

Doing a squash would have the following advantages:
- will keep out git history clean. Viewing the `git log` will clearly show how features were added/things were fixed. 
- will make it easier to check the change done by building a particular feature. Rather than viewing multiple commits `git show <commit_id>` will show the changes
- will make it easier to revert a change
- cherry picking a change to another branch(say release branch) would be much easier. :)

It would be great if we could reach a consensus on this and start following the practise. 

@misaochan @neslihanturan @nicolas-raoul @psh

title: Fix IndexOutOfBounds exception in Nearby
body:

body:
_Before creating an issue, please search the existing issues to see if a similar one has already been created. You can search issues by specific labels (e.g. `label:nearby `) or just by typing keywords into the search filter._

**Summary:** 

Summarize your issue in one sentence (what goes wrong, what did you expect to happen)

**Steps to reproduce:** 

How can we reproduce the issue?

**Add System logs:**

Add logcat files here (if possible).

**Expected behavior:** 

What did you expect the App to do?

**Observed behavior:** 

What did you see instead?  Describe your issue in detail here.

**Device and Android version:** 

What make and model device (e.g., Samsung J7) did you encounter this on?  What Android
version (e.g., Android 4.0 Ice Cream Sandwich or Android 6.0 Marshmallow) are you running?  Is it
 the stock version from the manufacturer or a custom ROM ?
 
 **Commons app version:** 

You can find this information by going to the navigation drawer in the app and tapping 'About'

title: Fix Travis build failures due to Nearby tests
label: [Label(name="assigned"), Label(name="beginner friendly"), Label(name="nearby"), Label(name="question"), Label(name="tests")]
body:
**Summary:** 

Travis has been failing ever since our Nearby overhaul, specifically due to Nearby tests failing. I would propose two steps to fix this problem:

1. First, temporarily remove all Nearby tests. This allows us to actually use Travis again for PR and build evaluation, instead of just assuming it will fail.

2. Then, re-create Nearby tests one by one.  Nearby has changed so significantly that I imagine we will need to rewrite the majority of the tests.

**Steps to reproduce:** 

Look at Travis builds and Nearby tests

**Would you like to work on the issue?**

Ideally, no :) Anyone, please feel free to take it up.

title: Fix strings in About
body:

![about](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3611199/37902608-4888bbd4-3138-11e8-9389-da0f37239fd2.png)

title: Additional fix for text wrap issue in Nearby
body:
One of the items needed in #1329 . I was wondering why the check for text wrap doesn't work for me, and it turns out that getLineCount() was returning 0. According to documentation, it seems that happens when the internal layout has not been built.

This seems like a simple workaround. Additionally, there is no need to check all the line lengths when "Directions" is the longest, so checking for that should simplify things.

Tested on Android 7.0 Samsung Galaxy s7

Would ideally be merged prior to release #1212

title: Merge Direct nearby uploads new branch to master
body:
The PR intends to merge the gigantic `directNearbyUploadsNew` branch to master. The branch is getting bigger and bigger and it might get difficult to maintain it given `master` is so active these days. The branch has a lot of new features and everything is not expected to work smoothly but we can pick up the issues one by one after the merge is completed. 

The next release is planned in the next 2 weeks. We should be able to fix any major issues before then.

title: Unable to get provider [ ModificationsContentProvider ]
body:
I'm using **directNearbyUploadsNew** branch
with sdk 19 , after installing the application and lunch it , it crush with this error : 
`Unable to get provider ModificationsContentProvider `
After searching i find this : 
[StackOverFlow question ](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/37312103/unable-to-get-provider-com-google-firebase-provider-firebaseinitprovider)

After using Application instead of MultiDexApplication in `CommonsApplication` class , and adding `    compile 'com.android.support:multidex:1.0.3'` in gradle dependencies 
the error is gone 
**Steps to reproduce:** 
- build and install the app in a device with sdk 19

**Device and Android version:** 
SDK 19 ( emulator )

 **Commons app version:** 
2.6.7-debug-directNearbyUploadsNews

title: Nearby Activity Floating Action buttons
body:
**Summary:** 
1 ) I'm using **directNearbyUploadsNew** branch
By going to NearbyActivity i got the application stopped message 
it said :

`Attempt to invoke virtual method 'android.graphics.drawable.Drawable android.graphics.drawable.Drawable$ConstantState.newDrawable()' on a null object reference`

2 ) also after fixing that , and by choosing a marker from the map
there no icons inside [fab_galery,fab_camera]

**Steps to reproduce:** 
- Enter to NearbyActivity
- The app will crash 

**System logs:**
`Attempt to invoke virtual method 'android.graphics.drawable.Drawable android.graphics.drawable.Drawable$ConstantState.newDrawable()' on a null object reference`

**Device and Android version:** 
Galaxy note 3 : android 5 [ sdk 21 ]
 
 **Commons app version:** 
2.6.7-debug-directNearbyUploadsNews ~1e83d67c
**Screen-shots:** 
![29134732_2105593989468876_763814720_n](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17969012/37646457-0a7e2788-2c2a-11e8-8e6a-8fa4d258bba1.png)


**Would you like to work on the issue?**

1 ) i worked on it , and after searching i find that this error is because : 
because of `android:backgroundTint="@color/button_blue"`
which should be `app:backgroundTint="@color/button_blue"`
2) and the second one . i solved it by adding  `android:src="....."` too , but in 4.4 and below Android versions it causes a crash. so i changed the Vector Drawable to a png and it work

2) After caching fail toast is displayed select a contribution

title: Current issues with direct Nearby uploads

body:
**Summary:** 

I thought we should probably keep a list of issues we are experiencing with the directNearbyUploadsNew feature branch, so we don't miss anything out before releasing to production. Please feel free to edit this post to add issues or detail for issues.

**Steps to reproduce:** 

Build from `2.7.x-release` and test the Nearby feature

- [x] 1. Memory leaks PR #1390 
- [x] 2. Crash when loading map (by the time I finished typing this out, I had lost the logcat. Sorry. :/ Will post when I encounter it again).
- [x] 3. <s>Text wrap issues in bottom sheet (see SS below). I would recommend removing "Directions" text</s>
- [x] 4. Fix "?" description bug in map (see SS below). This has already been fixed in list, we just need to copy the fix over to map. I should be able to do it after I'm done with my category PR.
- [x] 5. <s> Crash on orientation change</s> crashes when list view is open and orinetation changed. PR: #1385 
- [x] 6.  Bug: if you click one of nearby markers and make information bottom sheet visible, then go to settings and change theme, app will crash when you re-start nearby activity. Log is at below comment PR #1391
- [x] 7. <s> Action bar is hidden</s>
- [x] 8. Fix current location point visibility when bottom sheet is expanded, and re-center button is clicked. PR: #1381
- [x] 9. Fix transparent view is top of menu bar - PR is ready waiting for review #1378

**Summary:** 
When signing up through the app the checking for whether the user exists in the system done after pressing the signup button. Most of the times it ends up in multiple signup attempts.

**Steps to reproduce:** 
A signup with existing user name will reproduce.

**Expected behavior:** 

The check up for the user existence should be checked after the 'onchange' trigger of the username field. Then the requirement for multiple attempts can be avoided.

title: Image downloading fixed
body:
### Description
Clicking the download button now downloads each image uploaded in future without any kind of failure. The first download is however a bit slow, but the subsequent downloads happen in < 1 second.
The PR fixes #1216  

### Testing
The changes have been tested on a real-time device and a few corner cases for image titles have been tried out as well.
Tried out test cases: 
1) ČSD ř. M 260.001 1939-02.17. 24.jpg
2) دمشق جبل قاسيون.jpg
3) A. b. c. d 1.2 . 3

title: Category suggestions for direct nearby uploads
body:
This PR adds category suggestions to direct Nearby uploads. The category associated with the Wikidata item that the user is uploading from should be added to the top of the category suggestions screen. Not all Wikidata items have categories, however. To check if an item has a category when you test it, you can play around with the query [here](https://query.wikidata.org/#SELECT%0A%20%20%20%20%20%28SAMPLE%28%3Flocation%29%20as%20%3Flocation%29%0A%20%20%20%20%20%3Fitem%0A%20%20%20%20%20%28SAMPLE%28COALESCE%28%3Fitem_label_preferred_language%2C%20%3Fitem_label_any_language%29%29%20as%20%3Flabel%29%0A%20%20%20%20%20%28SAMPLE%28%3FclassId%29%20as%20%3Fclass%29%0A%20%20%20%20%20%28SAMPLE%28COALESCE%28%3Fclass_label_preferred_language%2C%20%3Fclass_label_any_language%2C%20%22%3F%22%29%29%20as%20%3Fclass_label%29%0A%20%20%20%20%20%28SAMPLE%28COALESCE%28%3Ficon0%2C%20%3Ficon1%29%29%20as%20%3Ficon%29%0A%20%20%20%20%20%28SAMPLE%28COALESCE%28%3Femoji0%2C%20%3Femoji1%29%29%20as%20%3Femoji%29%0A%20%20%20%20%20%28SAMPLE%28%3FCommons_category%29%20as%20%3FCommons_category%29%0A%20%20%20%20%20%3FwikipediaArticle%0A%20%20%20%20%20%3FcommonsArticle%0A%0A%20%20%20WHERE%20%7B%0A%20%20%20%20%20%23%20Around%20given%20location...%0A%20%20%20%20%20SERVICE%20wikibase%3Aaround%20%7B%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%3Fitem%20wdt%3AP625%20%3Flocation.%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20bd%3AserviceParam%20wikibase%3Acenter%20%22Point%28153.073%20-27.6111%29%22%5E%5Egeo%3AwktLiteral.%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20bd%3AserviceParam%20wikibase%3Aradius%20%225%22%20.%20%23%20Radius%20in%20kilometers.%0A%20%20%20%20%20%7D%0A%0A%20%20%20%20%20%23%20...%20and%20without%20an%20image.%0A%20%20%20%20%20MINUS%20%7B%3Fitem%20wdt%3AP18%20%5B%5D%7D%0A%0A%20%20%20%20%20%23%20Get%20the%20label%20in%20the%20preferred%20language%20of%20the%20user%2C%20or%20any%20other%20language%20if%20no%20label%20is%20available%20in%20that%20language.%0A%20%20%20%20%20OPTIONAL%20%7B%3Fitem%20rdfs%3Alabel%20%3Fitem_label_preferred_language.%20FILTER%20%28lang%28%3Fitem_label_preferred_language%29%20%3D%20%22en%22%29%7D%0A%20%20%20%20%20OPTIONAL%20%7B%3Fitem%20rdfs%3Alabel%20%3Fitem_label_any_language%7D%0A%0A%20%20%20%20%20%23%20Get%20Commons%20category%20%28P373%29%0A%20%20%20%20%20OPTIONAL%20%7B%20%3Fitem%20wdt%3AP373%20%3FCommons_category.%20%7D%0A%0A%20%20%20%20%20%23%20Get%20the%20c 0%3FcommonsArticle).

title: Wrong URL not found toast
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
**Summary:** 

URL not found toast is visible when license is null (I am not sure if this case is possible). The related code is here:
```
if (licenseLink(media) != null) {
            license.setOnClickListener(v -> openWebBrowser(licenseLink(media)));
        } else {
            Toast toast = Toast.makeText(getContext(), getString(R.string.null_url), Toast.LENGTH_SHORT);
            toast.show();
        }
```
However I can go to the license page by clicking license, so it shouldn't be null. 

**Steps to reproduce:** 

I faced this issue with some images. Just click on images to see media details page. However, this doesn't happen on each images, so try several:) 

**Add System logs:**

No logs

**Expected behavior:** 

Code should enable if statement instead of else

**Observed behavior:** 

Else statement is runned

**Device and Android version:** 
19 API level, prodDebug

**Screen-shots:** 
https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Special_bread_from_Turkey.jpg

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3127881/37513212-77e456d4-2915-11e8-86ff-a70d1b7b15b9.png)


**Would you like to work on the issue?**

No:D

title: Introducing a brief explanation of image license
body:
#### Summary
There should be a brief explanation of the licenses of images in the application to prevent the user from randomly choosing any license. 
For example-
There should be an explanation about:
1) CC0
2) Attribution 3.0
3) Attribution-ShareAlike 3.0
4) Attribution 4.0
5) Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0  

#### Commons app version 
Commons 2.6.7

#### Would you like to work on the issue?
Yes!

It would be great if everyone could give their suggestions on how to go about this and what all can be done to make the best fix :)

title: Orientation change cancels the ongoing login process.
label: [Label(name="assigned")]
body:
**Summary:** 

After filling the username and password, when we click on login button, a progress bar starts. But if orientation change takes place when the progress bar is active, it leads to cancellation of login process. Again the user has to tap login button to start the login process.

**Steps to reproduce:** 

1. Go to the login screen.
2. Fill out username and password field.
3. Click on Login button and change orientation while the progress bar is still active.

**Expected behavior:** 

The login process should continue even if orientation change occurs.

**Observed behavior:** 

The login process cancels if orientation change occurs.

**Device and Android version:** 

Redmi Note 4 Android 7.0 MIUI V9 Global
 
## Before

title: nearby activity: Stop the refresh and hide the layout
body:
Description
The nearby activity refresh layout (swipe up on the nearby activity) doesn't been hided when the refresh is aborted (for example, when the location doesn't change) 
Now, if the refresh doesn't take place than the circle will be hided and the refresh will stop.

title: feat: Add checks for title and description in intent extras. (#1273)
body:
In case other apps want to send a title and description along with the
image, we check if those have been passed as intent extras and set the
EditText values accordingly.

Fixes: #1273
See also: #892

title: Does not save the chosen categories of the picture and show up as "None provided"
body:
Summary:
Does not save the chosen categories of the picture and show up as "None provided"

Steps to reproduce:
1. Dowload the Wikimedia Commons (Beta) app from the Play Store
2. Try to upload picture from your gallery
3. Fill in the title and description in "Commons"
4. Mark the Category
5. press next 
6. open the uploaded picture from the "My Present Uploads" 
7. Look at the "Categories", there will be written "None selected"

Expected behavior : I expected that category that I chose will be saved and showed up at the picture's information. 

Observed behavior: Categories showed up as "None selected" even if I selected it.

Device: Sony Xperia XA Ultra
Android version: 7.0
 Commons app version: Version 2.6.7

title: can not go back from the "Categories" to the "Commons" by pressing the back arrow
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="metadata")]
body:
Hello Everyone, I am new to the open source software projects and I wanted to contribute as a tester. I downloaded the Wikimedia Commons (Beta)  app from the Play Store and tried to test it and found some strange behavior. 

Summary: 
I uploaded several pictures and during that I wanted to go back from the "Categories" to the "Commons" in order to make some modifications to the description of the picture. However by pressing the back arrow it does not go back from "Categories" to the "Commons" . It just go to the "Home", actually to "My Present Uploads" list where I saw my picture that was automatically uploaded. And now I can not change the description of that picture anymore.

Does it really works like that? Can anybody confirm this issue, please.    


Expected behavior: 
I just expected that after pressing back arrow it will go back to the "Commons" and will let me to make modifications in the title and description of the picture 

Steps to reproduce:
1. Dowload the (Beta) app from the Play Store
2. Try to upload picture from your gallery
3. Fill in the title and description in "Commons"
4.  go next
5. when the "Categories" open, go back by pressing the back arrow on the top left 


Device: Sony Xperia XA Ultra 
Android version: 7.0
 
Commons app version: Version 2.6.7

title: Provide intent to be easily callable from other apps
label: [Label(name="assigned"), Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
As Nemobis said at https://github.com/commons-app/apps-android-commons/issues/892 we won't get huge until we get integrated with apps that many people already use.

I believe that a first step towards that direction would be to implement an intent to let other apps open the Commons app.

Example scenario:
- While waiting at the airport, I stumble upon an Olympic player Li Jinyu, and take a picture
- I share it with my friends on the popular messaging app "Telegram" (open source), with the label "Just saw Li Jinyu at the Incheon airport!".
- After posting, Telegram shows me a button or something to post to Commons as well.
- I push that button, and Telegram launches an intent with the picture, the label, and potentially other useful info.
- The Commons app opens for that picture, with the image and label pre-filled.

I am sure there are better examples, please feel free to add more :-)
Intent design and naming ideas also welcome!

_Before creating an issue, please search the existing issues to see if a similar one has already been created. You can search issues by specific labels (e.g. `label:nearby `) or just by typing keywords into the search filter._

Summarize your issue in one sentence (what goes wrong, what did you expect to happen)

How can we reproduce the issue?

**Add System logs:**

Add logcat files here (if possible).

What did you expect the App to do?

What did you see instead?  Describe your issue in detail here.

version (e.g., Android 4.0 Ice Cream Sandwich or Android 6.0 Marshmallow) are you running?  Is it
 the stock version from the manufacturer or a custom ROM ?

You can find this information by going to the navigation drawer in the app and tapping 'About'

Can be created by pressing the Volume Down and Power Button at the same time on Android 4.0 and higher.

title: Image downloading fixed
body:
### Description
Clicking the download button now downloads each image uploaded in future without any kind of failure. The PR fixes #1216. 
Changes were made to SingleUploadFragment.java where the title of the image was modified in a way so as to handle the incoming of spaces in the formed URL. The spaces was replaced by a '_' 
This works for all the newly uploaded images in the future and not for previously existing images, since their URL has already been formed while uploading them to the database.

### Testing
The changes have been tested on a real-time device and a few corner cases for image titles have been tried out as well.
Tried out test cases: 
1) ČSD ř. M 260.001 1939-02.17. 24.jpg
2) دمشق جبل قاسيون.jpg
3) A. b. c. d 1.2 . 3

Please review and give your inputs :-)

title: When selecting category, show sample images
label: [Label(name="assigned"), Label(name="beginner friendly"), Label(name="categorization"), Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
It can be hard to know whether you have found the right category just by its name.

The category could be for a different thing that bears the same name (and no category exists yet for the thing you took a picture of). Or you might have chosen a spelling different from the one used on Commons and the category is about something else. Or you might have a typo.

Solution: Show a few sample pictures from within the category. They could show as a popup whenever you select a category.

title: Real time location track
body:
## Description
Makes real time position track posible

Fixes #686 

Another type of callback is added to LocationCahngedManager so that we are notified for slight location changes and significant ones. 
- Tracks user on walking or driving.
- Uploads new nearby markers whenever user went out of current area composed from current nearby markers.
- Makes current position marker visible whenever bottom list sheet is visible or not. 
- Updates items in the list view when new nearby markers comes, means on significant update.

Note: You can use Lockito app to simulate a moving route.
Also Note: Please do not merge this yet since it has some known bugs:
- Doesn't clean old markers in some cases.
- Of course conflicts...

## Screencast showing what changed
 
![realtimelocation](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3127881/36925396-d089ccac-1e83-11e8-8f67-01f941fa1e1d.gif)

title: Remove hurdle of creating an account
label: [Label(name="debated"), Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Google Play statistics suggests that a lot of people uninstall the app just after installing it.
I suspect that the biggest blocker is the login screen. Most people probably give up at that step.

Proposed solution: Allow people to browse Commons, and even upload pictures, without the hurdle of choosing a username and password.

The app could show: Log in with existing account / Create an account / Continue without an account

"Continue without an account" would actually create a random name and password, and store them in the app's local database.
Uninstalling the app would mean the account is lost forever. Or we could have a small dialog that shows the username/password that have been created.

I am not sure whether all of this is possible (for instance account creation might require solving a captcha which might be difficult to make the user solve), but it might be worth considering.

title: Add re-center button to Nearby map (in feature branch)
label: [Label(name="assigned"), Label(name="debated"), Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="nearby")]
body:
After testing the Nearby feature in `directNearbyUploads` branch for a bit, I really think that we need to provide a way for users to re-center the map on their current location. Users will be swiping a lot to switch between the list and the map - and if they swipe wrongly and move the map away, they have to reload Nearby or manually go back to their location.

I do recall that we discussed this somewhere else and it was mentioned that the Material guidelines recommend not having more than 1 FAB in the screen. However, I think that a small re-center icon on the upper right would not be amiss, especially given that our other FAB is actually in the bottom sheet and not on the map itself. For reference, Google Maps also uses 3 FABs, 1 of which is the re-center button.

Thoughts?

title: Items needed for v2.7 release

- [x] Memory leaks in Nearby solved #1368
- [x] Other Nearby fixes (more detail in #1329 ):

   - Known crashes fixed

- [x] #7 , including changes requested
- [x] #686 if possible

- [x] All of the above merged into master and tested on prodRelease build
- [x] Make sure that Dagger NPE fixes from previous release are included

title: issue #1130 -(j). bad Token Exception from showDialog() in ExistingFi…
body:
For #1130  (j), the exception occurs when app tries to open a dialog from ExistingFileAsync (extends AsyncTaskin) in this case. To fix, we can check if parent activity (the share activity in this case) is still running and show dialog only when it's finished.
To get parent activity into the  ExistingFileAsync class, we can pass it as a parameter. But, this will cause memory leaks when task is complete. 
![weak](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25305892/36652870-875fb1ac-1a7f-11e8-9e6a-0f8a0ba0be9c.png)
Solution is to use WeakReference to let the Garbage collector know. I also changed context to be a weakReference. 
Best

body:
**Summary:** 

Instead of showing only the email clients, The Feedback feature is showing multiple unsupported clients (WhatsApp, Bluetooth etc.). 

**Steps to reproduce:** 
1. Install some apps which can be used for sharing. ( e.g. WhatsApp, Bluetooth)

Multiple unsupported clients being displayed.

Show the email clients only, not all the other available sharing apps. Not only will it reduce the chances of running into an error upon the selection of an unsupported app, but User's time will also be saved.

title: Orientation change in Notification activity causes it to reload notifications.
body:
**Summary:** 

When there occurs a orientation change in Notification activity, notification's list is again fetched from the server.

**Steps to reproduce:** 

1. Go to Notifications from navigation drawer.
2. Change the orientation of the phone.

**Expected behavior:** 

Notifications list should be retained across orientation change for better UX, reduced loading time and network usage.

**Observed behavior:** 

 Notification's list is again fetched from the server.

**I have already made a fix, only creating a PR is left**

title: [Discussion] Announce the app on Wikimedia Commons Mobile
label: [Label(name="publicity")]
body:
Wikimedia Commons Mobile (https://commons.m.wikimedia.org/wiki/Main_Page) is the mobile site for the webbrowsers, but it is imho alpha. it does not support gadgets, the improved upload form is not supported, no real mobile upload client, etc. etc. 

I am inclined to announce the app somewhere there.

Maybe on the (Mobile) Main Page?
Or we could add it somewhere to he interface (for example to the navbar or footer) using https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/MediaWiki:Mobile.js

title: Option to edit Images in App before Uploading
label: [Label(name="debated"), Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
**Summary:** 

The app should have image editing feature like on facebook/Instagram.

**Steps to reproduce:** 

Include open-cv-android SDK or any other SDK and add features one by one.

**Expected behavior:** 

The app should have image editing feature like on facebook/Instagram.

Desirable features:

- Crop (especially lossless resize à la jpegtran)
- Rotate (90, 180, 270 degrees)
- White balance
- Brightness
- Modify EXIF
- Anonymize (see #70)
- HDR (sounds difficult to implement though)

Undesirable features:

- Color filters such as Sajuno/Manglow/Palacia/Anax/etc (original colors are better)
- Flip horizontally/vertically (misleading)
- Black and white, sepia, etc (loss of information)
- Resize (original size is the best)
- Stickers
- Pencil, text

**Observed behavior:** 

No image editing feature is present.

**Screen-shots:** 

![screenshot_20180224-182942](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19607555/36630762-b06cd85c-1991-11e8-83aa-a2d67fb12b9f.png)

title: Additional fix: Refreshing stopped if no change in location

- When no change to location occurs the refresh of nearby location doesn't occur now.
- This change has been incorporated for both Pull down gesture refreshing and for the Refresh Button
- I added a flag to ensure that OnLocationChanged() doesn't call refreshView() when location hasn't changed.

title: Orientation change in NearbyActivity causes it to reinitialise NearbyListFragment.
body:
**Summary:** 

When there occurs a orientation change in NearybyActivty, it reinitialise the NearbyListFragment and reloads the data again. 

**Steps to reproduce:** 

1. Go Nearby Places activity from navigation drawer.
2. Load the list of nearby places as shown below:

![nearby places list](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20313518/36594302-977c0206-18c3-11e8-9aee-0b1a42df6a55.png)

3. Change the orientation of phone.


**Expected behavior:** 

Change in orientation should check whether there already exists a instance of NearbyListFragment,
if not, then only a new instance of NearbyListFragment should be created.

**Observed behavior:** 

During orientation change in NearybyActivty, it reinitialise the NearbyListFragment.

**I am working on the issue.**

**Update**
Issue has been fixed.

title: Edittext in SingleUploadFragment lacks Material design, No scrolling behaviour and limit on text size in edit text causes content to be cut-off from screen.
body:
**Summary:** 
1. Image's title and description edit text in SingleUploadFragment lacks Material Design.
2. Lack of scrolling behaviour and text size limit in SingleUploadFragment causes content to be cut-off from screen.
3. There is no text size limit on Image's title and description, is this intentional or should there be appropriate limit on it?

**Steps to reproduce:** 

1. Select a photo to upload.
2. Enter appropriately large text in title and description or change device orientation to landscape.

**Expected behavior:** 

1. Users should be able to scroll vertically in case image's title and description exceeds device's screen size.
2. There maybe be a appropriate limit on image's title and description.

**Observed behavior:** 
No such scrolling behaviour  and limit on image's title and description size exists.

**Screen-shots:** 
![landscape](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20313518/36589148-59873528-18b0-11e8-87d0-f711749bf728.png)

![text](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20313518/36589152-59f98ae2-18b0-11e8-81f5-06ead818da66.png)



**I am working on the issue.**

@maskaravivek Can you suggest if any, limit on text size of image's title and description?

**Update**
Issue has been fixed.

title: Preview image in ShareActivity fails to load
body:
Sometimes when the selected image is heavy the preview image in ShareActivity, the one that appears in the background of the title and descriptions screen, fails to load.  This mostly happens when the camera operates at maximum resolution. If the resolution of the image is a couple of notches lower it loads just fine.

Observed 

![godavnvis](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26009796/36500454-56348782-176a-11e8-8a52-22121852130d.png)


Expected (This was achieved by clicking the same photo at a lower resolution using open camera)

![godavvis](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26009796/36500267-dc6633ce-1769-11e8-87b3-a92f01adef4e.png)


Device and Android version: 
Xiaomi Redmi 4A, Android 6.0.1, MIUI 8.5.7.0

Solution: I think most of this can be solved by using downsampling and resizing functions of fresco given  [here .](http://frescolib.org/docs/resizing.html) I also came across #889 which intents to replace fresco with glide. 

I'd like to work on this if the community feels it's a good idea. 

Cheers!

title: Bug: Reinstall of app and using an existing account causes a different imageurl to be saved
body:
**Summary:** 

When making a contribution the imageUrl variable of Media.java is set correctly so that it can be entered in a browser and the image appears. If the app is then uninstalled or the data is cleared and you log into the same account the imageUrl of the same Media is set to a different link that leads to a 404. 

**Steps to reproduce:** 

1) Make a contribution and get the string stored in imageUrl.
2) Reinstall app.
3) Log into same account as before.
4) Load the same contribution as before and get the imageUrl
5) The urls are different, and the new one is a 404

**Expected behavior:** 

The urls should be the same

**Observed behavior:** 

The current code does not cause this to lead to a bad result. But further changes could depend on the imageUrl to be constant. I discovered this while trying to implement Glide for image loading

**Device and Android version:** 

Pixel 2 XL emulator running Oreo
 
 **Commons app version:** 

2.6.7

title: Fix issue #1030: Spinning wheel overlaps on text input, when using Hebrew locale
body:
The issue arises for any locale which uses language read from right to left.

Since category search is implemented only in English, it is expected that the user will use English in category search. Hence, to fix this, I changed the editText gravity to the left and the progressBar gravity to the right, instead of letting it adapt to the locale as Android's default behaviour allows.

title: Crashes; user has no web browser installed and tries to open any URL
body:
So I had disabled my web browser because I was using it a lot at bedtime. Because of this, I kept getting a "No Activity Found" exception for many/any click(s) that open a web browser, such as on click on license and category of a photo, "open in web browser" option, links in the about page, etc.  The documentation for Intent actually reads this 

[> Caution: If there are no apps on the device that can receive the implicit intent, your app will crash when it calls startActivity()](https://developer.android.com/guide/components/intents-common.html)

The solution is simple and good code practice; start activity only after checking for null activity. Launch only if activity is not null, otherwise post a[ toast](https://developer.android.com/guide/topics/ui/notifiers/toasts.html) message, something like "no app found to open URL" (I've seen many other apps give me such a toast recently)

I've started working on this; Expect a pull request soon :-)

title: Can we update minSdkVersion?
label: [Label(name="debated"), Label(name="question")]
body:
Google's [version dashboard](https://developer.android.com/about/dashboards/index.html) is reporting very small numbers for certain versions of Android.  Particularly,

| API Level | Distribution |
| ---- | ----- |
| API 15 (Ice Cream Sandwich) | **0.4 %** |
| API 16 (Jelly Bean) | **1.7%** |
| API 17 (Jelly Bean) | **2.6%** |
| API 18 (Jelly Bean) | **0.7%** |

Does the Google Play Store give insight to our actual users and the versions in use?

In the absence of hard numbers from actual users, could we move up to API 19 (KitKat) or at the very least, API 16?

title: Converted to Butterknife bindings
body: The app already contains Butterknife, so views bindings in MediaDetailFragment were updated to use Butterknife.

title: Thinking about a combined "share" GUI
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="gallery"), Label(name="question")]
body:
I spent some time in [Sketch](https://www.sketchapp.com/) today thinking about what a user interface might look like if we combined the single-share and multi-share activities into a single workflow.  The thought experiment was about sharing 4 images with the Commons app, noting that we've had requests for 

* the ability to add title + description to all images in a set 
* pinch + zoom to scale the image
* ability to review images and see them more clearly
* clearer presentation of the policy declaration that doesn't interfere with the image

(Issues #604, #1074, etc)

![share activity - step 1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/407647/36012777-10ae0470-0d26-11e8-984b-c5ce44178a40.png)

Both the top and bottom cards would be (independently) collapsable to allow full access to the image.  Without the previous smoky transparent overlay the image is fully visible.  The small images in the top card scroll horizontally and tapping one pulls it up as the full screen image for review.

![share activity - step 1a](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/407647/36012817-5b94d2b6-0d26-11e8-8eae-904d08af5c2f.png)![share activity collapsed - step 1a](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/407647/36012837-7e32544c-0d26-11e8-80ac-7458d6414e73.png)

Note: if you were uploading only a single image then the top card would be hidden, and this first step of the wizard would be skipped taking you directly to adding title and description.

![share activity - step 2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/407647/36012870-b7afd55a-0d26-11e8-8212-b769f3284355.png)

The wizard would step forward through the images making each the background of the whole screen to let you pick the best title + description.  We could name them the same as we do now - prefill the title - with the set name and a sequence number.  It would make sense to auto-collapse the top card as the wizard is now in control of which image is "selected" in the preview list - its tied directly to the step of the wizard that we are on.

![stack](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/407647/36013068-ad7404b6-0d27-11e8-8b23-018669f66c95.png)

When we're done stepping through giving titles to them all, we add categories.  As with the current upload these are common across all the group.  Is there a need to tie them directly to each image?

![share activity - step 6](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/407647/36013159-36babd00-0d28-11e8-9424-efc4467e0945.png)

Lastly we would select the license and show the _"By submitting this picture, I declare that this is my own work, that it does not contain copyrighted material or selfies, and otherwise adheres to Wikimedia Commons policies."_ at the point of tapping submit.

![share activity - step 7](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/407647/36013179-649e542a-0d28-11e8-8550-345bf6f2b86e.png)

The number of steps is dynamic based on the number of images shared.

If I share a single image then we would show a 3 step wizard

* Step 1 of 3 - enter title + description
* Step 2 of 3 - select categories
* Step 3 of 3 - license and policy click-through to *submit*

title: Create CONTRIBUTING.md
Open map of place where picture was taken
label: [Label(name="assigned"), Label(name="categorization")]
body:
I often want to check on Google Maps what is the exact name of a building, or find out what is that thing in the background, or determine whether I was technically in North-Kilda or South-Kilda.
This could be another button in the description screen, but actually I often need it in the categories screen, when two proximity categories appear and I need to choose the right one.
It should open the default map app.

title: Changing our release and hotfix system
label: [Label(name="high priority")]
body:
Currently, all releases are done from master, and all hotfixes to release issues are also submitted to master. Brief history of the problems that we are encountering with our current release system:

- We had a major issue with Dagger crashes in 2.6.5, which was solved by #1062 
- #1062 was released via 2.6.6
- 2.6.6 fixed the Dagger crash from 2.6.5, but also included other changes that caused a different type of crash, with an even higher crash rate
- We wanted to roll back to 2.6.5 while cherry-picking the Dagger fixes
- This turned out to be extremely difficult because the Dagger fixes built on other code changes that were submitted to master between 2.6.5 and 2.6.6.

In the future, I'm thinking that we might want to change how we do hotfix releases. My proposed new system:
- Every major release (e.g. 2.6), I will pull from master and create a new branch (e.g. `2.6.x-release`)
- Hotfixes to the major release must be done in the `2.6.x-release` branch, not in master
- Hotfix releases (e.g. 2.6.1) will be pulled from the `2.6.x-release` branch. New changes/enhancements to master will not be included in the hotfix release
- Release branches will be merged into master periodically (so master is up to date with hotfixes made to release branches)
- Hotfixes can be released to production after being tested in beta for a few days. Major releases on the other hand should be tested in beta for a much longer time (e.g. 2 weeks?)

I believe that this will allow us to make hotfixes more easily and independently of master, and reduce the headaches that we are facing currently. Given that major releases are expected to be the least stable, they should also be tested the most vigorously.

title: Nearby listings from Wikivoyage
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="nearby")]
body:
Most Wikivoyage listings have no Wikidata item (because they are about not-so-notable things such as a small castle or local museum).
But many have latitude/longitude, and all accept an `image=` parameter which is often empty. This image is used in dynamic maps.

Having pictures for these would improve Wikivoyage, which is a WMF project.

Example: The tunnels at https://en.wikivoyage.org/wiki/Kinmen#See

A database of Wikivoyage listings is available at https://github.com/baturin/wikivoyage-listings
A live API is available at http://wvpoi.batalex.ru/api/
Example request: http://wvpoi.batalex.ru/api/get-listings/?language=en&positional_data=true&limit=200&format=geojson&min_latitude=41.97480631113838&max_latitude=42.582410848693954&min_longitude=-71.62948608398438&max_longitude=-70.06668090820312 (note: the `image` parameter does not seem to be available currently, see https://github.com/baturin/wikivoyage-listings/issues/57)

Warnings:
- The API is not live, so points will not disappear until 2 weeks (at most) later
- Adding the uploaded images to Wikivoyage involves editing the wikicode. This could be done by a bot, with the Commons app only sending data to that bot.
- Some listings exist in different language versions of Wikivoyage. An easy could be to only use the English Wikivoyage at first.
- I have proposed moving listings to Wikidata (which would make this issue pointless), but I don't see this happening within 10 years, so I believe this issue is worth implementing.

title: Avoid "dynamism" in the login screen
body:
By "dynamism", I mean trying to keep the username and password fields always at the center of the available screen space. This distracts the user when he fills in the fields.

From #1106,
>The login page (username and password input fields) seems to shifting itself to remain in the center with respect to the available screen height. This movement doesn't seem to be a big deal if it only happens when the users keyboard pops in and pops out. In some cases the user's keyboard might suggest things as he types. These suggestions pop in and pop out above the keyboard itself as and when required. This results in the login page moving when the user types his username. This seems to be disturbing to the user as he notices something moving on his screen which generally doesn't happen in case of login screens.
>
>...
>
>**Screen shots**
>![screenshot_20180123-214313](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12448084/35294165-e9c8a450-009b-11e8-9c7f-2f42fe915954.png)
>![screenshot_20180123-214311](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12448084/35294223-ff10b14a-009b-11e8-8b42-8c3866df8214.png)

title: Completely overhaul app's User Interface
body:
This is a discussion thread similar to #1092. This was initially a comment in the same thread.

I have long been thinking of suggesting a similar issue for the UI. Though the recent overhaul had made some significant improvements, I still thinks it would be better to completely overhaul the UI as I could still see some dominance of legacy UI even after some overhaul.

As an motivator for why I think of a complete overhaul, consider the login screen. It was recently modified. The new design definitely seems better than the old one except for one thing the **dynamism**. The login page (username and password input fields) seems to shifting itself to remain in the center with respect to the available screen height. This movement doesn't seem to be a big deal if it only happens when the users keyboard pops in and pops out. In some cases the user's keyboard might suggest things as he types. These suggestions pop in and pop out above the keyboard itself as and when required. This results in the login page moving when the user types his username. This seems to be disturbing to the user as he notices something moving on his screen which generally doesn't happen in case of login screens.

I find this to be a consequence of trying to revamp over the legacy UI. This is why I suggest a complete UI overhaul. I guess that comes to a "rewrite the app completely" to some extent :)

**Screen shots**
![screenshot_20180123-214313](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12448084/35294165-e9c8a450-009b-11e8-9c7f-2f42fe915954.png)
![screenshot_20180123-214311](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12448084/35294223-ff10b14a-009b-11e8-8b42-8c3866df8214.png)
